reviews.review: Probably the most beautiful spot of them all. Probably the most beautiful view in the area, the color of the water with the rocky clifs makes this a very beautiful spot for visiting or staying.

Fishing Village with a view. Hout bay can be reached on the Hop on Hop off bus.Walk on the sand, enjoy an ice cream or fish and chip meal.Saturday's and Sunday's Hout Bay Markets are situated further along from the bus stop at the turn around point.We asked the driver to let us off there.These markets are worth a visit. Food, entertainment and market stalls.Lots of atmosphere at these local markets.
Lunch venue. We drove through Chapmans peak a must for fantastic coastal scenery in the Western Cape .Stopped at Hout bay for lunch at the Mariners lovely fish n chips and seafood chowder .
SEA FOOD.....BEACH....AND AGR8 VIEW. It the perfect beach gateway.....U have all the usual attractions....SCUBA DIVE...Surfing...and some gr8 sea food.... In Cape Town...its a must

A Beautiful Fishing Village Community. Hout Bay is only 20 minutes along a beautiful coastal road outside Cape Town but it feels so different. It has developed from a small fishing village into a thriving community. You can still visit the beach and fishing wharfs and some restaurants serving the catch of the day, but there is so much more to discover away from the waterfront. Cute shops and restaurants and the Friday night and weekend market. There is also a nice little animal sanctuary in town.

Nice town, service a bit lacklustre. Hout Bay is one of those villages where people not living there are regarded as a necessary evil. Whilst not hostile, the local service levels are often not very good. The seafood available at the harbour is excellent and the craft market is also a very interesting place to visit
Relaxing. With white sandy beaches and the ocean. Shops nearby and friends. There are beautiful views 360 degrees a perfect place for relaxing and dining.

Seals. Great weather for a boat ride to see the Cape Fur Seals. Interesting little things they are. There are also some seals on the wharf that do tricks with some of the locals, watch out you don't have to pat too much for the tricks.There is also a market on the wharf where you can buy lot of trinkets and things
stunning drive. More open that Cape Town. Different vibe. More coastal. Amazing drive with fantastic scenery on the way from Cape Town. Holiday coastal feel, wonderful sand and crisp water.

Pretty spot. Hout Bay is a very pretty area. We passed by on a number of occasions when we took the Hop on Hop off bus around Cape Town. Weekends were frantic but so many people accessed the restaurants for fresh seafood and chips.
Overall. Far much better than Camps Bay in the terms of the beach & ocean...a very nice drive too...very scenic & beautiful houses.
Lovely visit. One of the beautiful beaches of Cape Town. Very young, trendy and enjoyable. Highly recommended to anyinet

Slightly quieter part of Cape Town, although others might disagree. Hout Bay used to be a small quaint seaside village, with a fishing harbor, far from the bustling crowd. Over the years it has developed into a sometimes hectic large suburb with thousands of houses, an informal settlement, hundreds of businesses and restaurants. But is still very scenic. Its worth a visit.Some suggestions- Chapmans Peak Hotel (good seafood, great sunset spot overlooking a beach)- access point to Chapmans Peak Drive, possibly the most scenic spot in Cape Town- the food and goods market at the harbour- World of Birds (quick and easy way to see a variety of African birds, especially raptors)In truth, the beach is not great and the waters are polluted (but the City is working on that)

A bit left behind.. Houtbay has a beautiful harbour and location. The town how ever can not escape the intrusion of the squatter camp and leaves one feeling a bit edgy. In addition the feeling is just of being the neglected stepsister of the seaboard. We went for lunch but 3 of the 4 restuarants we approached would not open before 12.

One of the best cycling parts of Cape Town...if not the world!. I always look for any excuse to find reason to cycle from the Cape Town city centre, via Camp's Bay to Hout's Bay. If not a cyclist, it still one of the best corners of Cape Town, with lovely places to eat.

Pretty . Came here twice in two days.First day I ran here from Camps Bay. This was one of the most beautiful runs ever, right along the coast road.Second time I came as part of a tour group and got more time to explore.Market and harbour were interesting and scenery is stunning.

Give a "Shout for Hout". Hout Bay is the culmination of many scenic spots from. Cape Town about 1-1/2 Hour drive and a fishermans wharf that caters boat tours studded with sail boat wharfs and good sea food restaurants. We went to the Mariners Wharf restaurant and had a good seafood lunch. I recommend the "Kingklip", baby kingklip. Overrated the whole plate with succulent soft white fish very tasty and not fishy in flavor. With a Black Label Liter of beer.

Great Vibrant Harbour, Spectacular Views Over the Bay. We were on a small group tour and dropped into Hout Bay on our way to the Cape.The harbour side is a vibrant area being the starting point for many boating tours out to the seal colony. There are quite a few eateries in the area and lots of local vendors selling their wares.From here we drove to Chapman's Peak which has the best views over the spectacular Houts Bay. So very pretty. There are quite a few vantage and picnic spots along this scenic drive. If you are heading down to the Cape make sure you go along this road at least in one direction or you will miss out on some of the best scenery in South Africa.
Amazing beach . Beautiful and quite beach, with a spectacular view, you can see the fishing vessels and the seals jumped in front of you ..
One of the most amazing views in the world. Just stunning views overlooking Hout Bay as you drive through the area and up Chapmans Peak Drive. You simply have to see this if you visit Cape Town
Very basic authentic harbour.. Very crowded beach. go there for live crayfish in season or a boat cruise. Many eateries catering for many appetites.
So nice. Just a fun town w/a great beach and nice restaurants. We were there in the spring time. Cant imagine how much fun when it was in season.

Harbour area to Seal tour . Visit to hout bay is amazing and there are many cruise opeators where small cruise takes us to near a island having hundreds of Seal Earlier we saw seal only in pics but here seen in real and hundreds of seal resting on island and floating in nearby water .Advised to sit on left side of cruise and its very Windy , So carry woollens . If sitting in front of cruise than take care of Mobiles and cameras as salty water can damage them instantly .Hout bay is full of traditional african wooden artisans .
Mr. Good to stop and see harbour and do boat trip. Nice sea food at local restairants and affordable. Good service.

A hidden gem. From the roadside it looks as though there's nothing much at Hoult Bay but there's great fish restaurants, lots of people watching and a beautiful sandy beach. As a working port there's loads of comings and goings. About five minutes walk away is a great market full of trinkets and fresh food

Seal on the dock! . Easily accessible by Myciti bus transport in Cape Town, Hout Bay is a nice and calm place to take a ferry to watch seal in south Africa. If you are lucky, seals will come to the dock, so you will save your time and money.In Hout Bay, seafood restaurants are also a good reason for you to go there, fresh and less expensive compared to the city centre.
Good for visiting on the route. You are able to see seals as well as nice view. There is also nice beach that you can swim. You can combine cape point, boulders beach and hout bay together in one day

Went to see the seals. We visited Hout Bay to go and see the seals. We managed to get on a boat and saw them all sprawled out sleeping under the sun, some where swimming in the ocean and seemed quite used to seeing the boats. The boat trip took 45 minutes in total and was well worth it.
Beautiful scenery. I really loved it with the wonderful beach and amazing mountain's. Throughout the day there is a wind to keep the temperature down.

Love the view from Chapmans Peak. Wonderful coastline, so photogenic; beaches blue water and blue skies; good restaurants and bars, just a few locals in the lay-bys who would love you to buy their wares

Very quaint and picturesque!. Our group really doesn't go into the town proper, but we do go to the docks where a lot of our folks enjoy the boat out to Seal Island. Furthermore, there are lots of curio shops and wonderful views all along the docks. A great place to visit!
Attractive and a bit different. Not sure I would go here instead of camps bay but it was worth a couple of hours and had a different vibe.
Stunning views. We went via Hout Bay on our way to Seal Island. The coastal route was srikingly beautiful with coast on one side and high end houses on other. We drove through the town.

Worth a visit!. This is a quirky little town which developed around a natural harbour, its scenic attraction is highlighted by the rocky bastions which guard the entrance to the sheltered waters. At one time it was a very busy fishing harbour, but sadly, as catches diminished, so did the activity in the harbour. Today it is a dormer town, with many folk who work in Cape Town, 20 kms away,chosing to live here. It is still a pretty place, but if you are considering a visit, try and time it over the weekend, so you can catch the markets. There are more than enough activities around Hout Bay to make it your holiday base - and there are really a huge variety of restaurants from which to choose!

Beautiful place. From here you can go on boat trips to see seals, but I was entertained by a local boy who sat on the quayside and fed the seals - he had trained them to jump and take fish from his mouth. A lot of stalls selling the usual choice of items, most of which I am sure are mass produced. Driving around the bay there are wonderful viewpoints. Very nice restaurant on the quay.

Amazing place. Clean ans safe, They have a local that has a seal that he feeds. Can get up close and touch the seal, while it is a while animal it is amazing to be so close to such giants. Feeding the seagulls by the cannons was fun. The view is amazing, definitely a place to stop at. The sand is clean and white, water is clear. And head to Mariners Wharf for a delicious calamari and chips.

Scenic Town Near Cape Town. What a gorgeous town! We wandered around the town for 1-2 hours during our Cape tour, and then had the opportunity to view it from across the bay as we traveled South to the Cape. Beautiful location, very scenic, friendly people, tons of street vendors.
Best whale watching view points. take the coastal highway and sop and various viewpoints, enjoy the coastal scenery and visit some vineyards. Stop at whale watching locations such as Hermanus.
Beautiful drive. We enjoyed out drive around Hout Bay and seeing the leopard watching over the bay. It was lovely. I would recommend seeing this area, and the little quaint towns around the bay.
Fun day out. We spent the day in hout Bay eating typical fish And chips. We watched the locals feeding fish to The seals.

A dump. Avoid. This place was recommended by a friend. Even with stopping for a coffee we struggled to fill an hour and did not feel safe.
Been once won't be going back

Come here to enjoy natural beauty.. The best way to get here, the easiest, is to take City Sightseeing hop on hop off bus. Very pretty views, landscape. We did not go to the Seal Island but perhaps next time. It is pleasant just to stroll and look around and take in all the naturl beauty.
Many people seem to come here to fish.

Scenic and worthwhile visit. Scenic location and worth a visit. We always get some fish at the wharf - inexpensive, but fresh and tasty. Possibly not a destination on it's own, but a good stop on a trip around the coast.

Beautiful and scenic. Travelled here on the hop on hop off bus and was glad we got off here. Well worth a visit and a walk along the front. Not commercialised but a good choice of eateries and a few souvenir stalls. You can also go from here to seal island but allow more time
Picturesque with fun shops and eateries. I biked from Seapoint to Camps Bay (rentals for 60 rand for an hour) than hopped on a bus to Hout Bay. Wasn't disappointed.

Seafood Lovers. Hout Bay is a quaint destination to visit. Close to the docks you will see the fishermen arriving with their small boats and fish to sell. You could by fresh fish for a reasonable price if lucky. On the Rocks restaurant serves divine seafood. the prices are reasonable. and the food is fresh and tasty. You have the best seaviews and can go for a boat ride. Offers a lot of pleasure. Or just hang out on the beach and enjoy wading in the water. I know that you will enjoy the Curio shops and just walking around the deck is a must see an do. Quite a safe area with less incidents. Not aware of anything major going on. You must see and experience it first hand. I love that section of the Western Cape. I Love the food and the views and just to be outdoors is such a wonderful experience!

We took a boat to Seal Island. We took a boat to see seal island. The whole trip took about 1 hour. The weather was great and the sea was more or less calm. We saw the seals and enjoyed their swimming and acting

Main attraction here is the tour to Seal Island. The water is nice and blue around here. We have stopped in the harbour to get a boat to seal island. The harbour has African singers, musicians, artisans, souvenir sellers and shops, restaurants.The boat we took to seal island was over-packed, so it was really hard to take good pictures (without a dirty glass separating us from the seals). It was a good experience though, the sea was a bit rough which I always enjoy.
Not much to see and do. We stopped at the port. there were shops and a seal, otherwise nothing. Stop when driving by but no detour.

Spectacular and Breathtaking! . Had the chance to drive up and down the coast and couldn't stop starring at the charms and views of Hout Bay. The views from the mountain are stunning and the background dramatic and gorgeous!

Port to the Seal Island, souvenirs, food. It is a beautiful port from where you can catch boats for several sites around. We visited the Seal island (a small rock island full of seals). You can also eat or buy souvenirs around.

A Charm Of It's Own. I visited the town on a bus stop over. From the harbour I caught a boat cruise out to Seal Island and along the coastal Chapmans Peak Drive. Once a day there is a longer cruise. Check by phoning and booking. it is only R85. The harbour provides many photo opportunities as it is a functioning fishing harbour.After the boat trip, I went to the Mariners Warf for a bite to eat. I thouroughly enjoyed it, even though I was on my own. We returned in the evening to go for supper to Posticino's, where we ate brilliant pizza.

Picturesque. This time visited Hout Bay during a bus tour which took us through the winelands through Hout Bay back to Cape Town. Blustery and cold wind in August but the bay looked splendid and the town still has that picturesque image. Great destination for seafood lovers.
Beautiful view. We had our own rental car and the drive to Hout Bay is easy. Parking is no problem. Views are breathtaking. I would go again and visit.

Simply charming little village. My friend and i went to Hout Bay to visit the markets. There were many places to eat inside the indoor market and the food was good. There were many stalls With many different items, mostly handmade.

Amazing Views. We stopped in Hout Bay to take in the Seal tour. A lovely little area with some beautiful bluffs and gorgeous coastline. Seal tour was a bit rough on the sea that day but still a cool things to see.

Loved the ferry drive to see the seals. We went there for a ferry drive. Since the waiting time for the ferry was nearly 40 mins we took a slow stroll and searched for a place to take some fish and chips. The chips was so well done in all senses I found it really nice. The 65 rand ferry drive is worth the money as you will have a lot to look out for. Especially the picturesque views.

Nice market during the weekend. You can visit a small, but nice market during Sunday. The most rewarding is the drive by car from Cape Town along the beach from Camps Bay to Hout Bay. The beach is nice in Hout Bay and the water is cold.

Hout Bay local yacht harbour craft sales....a delightful sight. All visitors to the local yacht harbour front have lots of chances to view the whole of Hout Bay from boats of the seal island tours, starting off at the harbour. The excellent restaurants, Mariner's Wharf and The Lookout Deck offer culinary delights next to the more informal take-away outlets within walking distance.Tourists enjoy the many African stalls offering local and imported African crafts of all materials and designs. Prices are very reasonable, even for the locals who tend to purchase presents for their overseas families/friends or themselves.
Breathtaking views. Stunning with the mountains falling into the sea. make sure you arrive in the bay through the mountains! Beautiful blue waters and long sandy Beach.
Quaint and Beautiful. Started out being a very cool morning but visit and talk with a few vendors and you will feel a lot better!! Take some money and bargain.
Mr Farouk Khan . It's worth the visit , snook , fish and chips , these are the specialty in this area, not everyone's kettle of fish but even if you're fussy , it's worth the trip.

A stop among the peninsula tour. Hout Bay is a good stop for shopping of handcrafts and African items. They display the goods on the port next to each other giving you the possibility to check everything and to choose at your convenience. We were lucky to see some locals playing guitare and singing for South Africa which gave a very nice ambiance

Make sure to visit the market & seals. Hout Bay has some incredible scenic views, including a ferry that takes you to an island where hundreds of seals live (you can also snorkel with them via Cape Town Bucket List). On the other side of the bay, be sure to visit the market (select weeknights and on weekend afternoons) for some lower-priced shopping than Cape Town and amazing food selections.

Beautiful sunset. On our way back from Cape Point we drove along Chapman's Peak. It was picturesque. We saw a group of seals on a boulder out from the bay which were basking in the sun... it was lovely. A very romantic place to be.

Picturesque and quiet. We visited the beach and harbour, with restaurants on site, in August 2016. It was warm and quiet with no interruptions unlike other beaches around Cape Town. The bay itself is very pretty and well worth a visit.
Worth a visit. There is a great market in Hout Bay and if you like fish then Mariner's Wharf is the place to go. It's a very quaint village with quite a few coffee shops that have free wifi

A nice place on the Cape Pennisula. Hout Bay is one of the major towns on the west coast of the Cape Pennisula between the city of Cape Town and Cape of Good Hope. Houtbay has a nice fishinh harbor with some very good fish restaurants and a bird park (with a few agressive birds and you better wear long trousers).

Beautiful enclave on this famous coastline . Such a stunning, clean and picturesque little town. Albeit a little distance from Cape Town city it's worth a day trip or even finding accommodation there and spending a week or 2. The beaches are lovely. Plenty of restaurants and a Woolworths. Houtbay lies at the foot of the Chapmanspeak drive which is a must do ride. Over weekends you will come across flea markets which adds to the charm of this town. Very quaint and pretty.

Very cute area. We stopped in to see the harbour. It was chilly and very windy. The were many trinket tents set up and I was able to get many gifts at reasonable prices. We saw some seals in the harbor and we enjoyed the hustle and bustle.

Hout Bay. Hout Bay@Cape Town, South Africa.
Please see my first impression photos!!! Thank you very much indeed.:-)

Beautiful spot. Had to go and see Hout Bay. Great scenic drive, whichever way you decide to come around.
Whats a day out to Hout Bay without fish and chips? Great food. Not that many restaurants to choose from. We had quite a wait for our food, but it was well worth it in the end.
Hout Bay. A more scenic route would be hard to find. Take Chapmans peak - toll road expebsive R42 per vehicle - well worth the wonderful views of the cape.
Lovely bay!. We only stopped off here for a short time before continuing on to Chapman's Peak but it was well worth a visit. We had a lovely walk along the sea front.

A REAL REPUBLIC. Hout Bay is a little gem in Cape Town area. Hidden behind the iconic Table Mountain, it has stunning views from Chapman's Peak drive and offers a variety of attractions to keep you busy, such as World of Birds, where you can spend the whole day, have a picnic or buy lunch and interact with animals. Ideal for school holiday outing with kids - which is what we did. There is the harbour with boat trips to view Cape fur Seals on Duiker Island with Drumbeat Charters. Lots of restaurants to choose from or bring your own picnic to the lovely beach. Anyone can enjoy this unique spot.

Quiet, white sandy beach covered in flotsam. . Hout Bay is like the smaller, more peaceful, less busy brother to Camps Bay. A big sheltered sandy bay but with lots of dead seaweed.A few places to eat and drink but a rather dull place compared to Camps Bay. Probably won't go back

Beautiful place to get all in one! excercise while walking, relaxing and refreshing!. The Harbour is the attraction for me. I love walking around all the quant little places, greeting the locals and enjoying the sea air. The air is always filled with a buzz here. Plentybplaces to eat at or boat rides to take. Parking is plenty. A good way to excercise, enjoy and relax.

Picturesque little harbour. Hout Bay is a bustling little harbour and is home to many great eateries and the Hout Bay Market. The Chapman's Peak drive starts from Hout Bay. There is a hefty toll fee to utilise this route which offers you spectacular views as you journey through the pass which hugs the mountain face. One can also visit the old forts built by the Dutch with the original cannons still standing on the slopes of Chapman's peak.

Beautiful!. Hout Bay is a beautiful area. Lovely million dollar homes, great place to visit on the tour bus. I would rate higher but its hard to understand that with all of the million dollar construction why are there still settlements? Why isn't someone building decent housing for these people who live in tin shacks, right across the street from a beautiful football field and lovely homes?

spectacular scenery. Hout Bay has some of the most spectacular scenery in the world. The famous Chapman's Peak Drive starts in Hout Bay and ends in Noordhoek. Unforgettable drive along the coast. Hout Bay Village has lovely beaches, restaurants and shops, as well as pristine wooded areas with ancient forests.

Mr. Great little harbour. Enjoy fresh fish and chips. Interesting market. Stunning scenery. Can get crowded on a hot weekend day. Plenty of seals and lovely drive to and from the harbour from the City. Chapman's peak drive starts there. Spectacular.

Hout bay. This is one of my favorite places in the Western Cape. Lovely beach and more than enough places to have anything from breakfast on the beach to easy or fancy lunch and then a romantic dinner. My favorite place is Chapmans Peak Hotel - they make the best calamari ever!!
Amazing Views. Stopped here on our way to cape of Good Hope.. very good views.. all our pictures looked perfect.. a good picture spot..
Snoekies. Suburb of Cape Town. Most picturesque area, surrounded by mountains and the sea. Great restaurants and shops. Very nice Barbour and harbor restaurant.

Fun opportunity to watch seals at play. Great opportunity to take a boat ride out to see the seals at play in beautiful waters with surrounding mountain ranges. If you have a tendency to get sea sick, sit near the back of the boat where the sometime rocky waters make for a moving vessel. But the views are wonderful. The ride itself is relatively inexpensive and a fun opportunity to get on the water and observe nature.

Beautiful even without the seals. Known to be a great spot to watch seals. However, we did not see any. It was beautiful nonetheless. Best way would be to get a meal at one of the restaurants with a good view.

Glad we stopped. We got off the blue route hop in hop off bus for an hour at Houts Bay and are glad we did. It's not plush but the beach is delightful and the boats and Mariners Wharf fish and chips were great.

Tatty. A seemingly compulsory early morning stop on tours to Cape Point, Hout Bay represents everything I dislike about tourist venues. The place has a run down appearance and seems crowded with stalls selling tourist tat and aggressive beggars feeding seals. I think the trip organisers should encourage the place to clean up its act or call elsewhere.

great place to watch seals. beautiful place to watch seals,not many tourist in this place so it wasn't crowded. this includes a 30 minute bumpy boat ride to the seal island !! hundreds of seals on the small seal island. this place isnt very touristy. expect the local capetown !!!

If weather great then the view on boats and harbour is funtastic. There is no sitting area for the people who want to admire the sea view.There is a lot of street dogs and people asking for money.The shocking experience how to earn money: the seal show.One overweight seal jumps on pavement and the young boys asking money from tourist for the fact they are feeding the seal.
Day outing.... This is always a must when visiting Cape Town....we walk around the harbour and watch all the activities happening... Seal feeding... Visiting Mariners Wharf...

A Nice Boardwalk and Chapman's Peak. Hout Bay used to be a pirate's cove. It is now a fairly well developed small town that has preserved a quaint boardwalk that can take you out in the bay. It is an enjoyable stop if you are driving from Cape Town around the penninsula. Just past Hout Bay you will climb up the Chapman's Peak highway and can look back over Hout Bay for some great photos. Hout Bay is also the place you can get a boat to Seal Island.
Mrs . Went to Mariners Warf . Awesome vibe. The food is great. Fresh fresh seafood. A must visit . Can take the Blue City Bus to Houtbay .
Hout Bay. We enjoyed Hout bay, it has the best fish and chip must to eat. has good natural view for photography.

love hout bay with is peaceful setting, the lovely beach and the nice restaurants. love this place, spend almost a week and found i didn't really need to leave to get a full experience and all services i needed. definitely a must visit

Diving with the seals. Had a full day out. From seal diving and filming everything on a hired gopro to the freshest fish from snoekies, strolling through the market and filling ourselves even more on the freshly made food. The views across the ocean were fun. The drive back over Chapmans Peak was brilliant and definitely the best way to leave Hout Bay. Take your camera.

Don't go near the men who feed the sealions. I have been to the Fishmarket Area, where there is plenty of souvenirs to buy. Don't go near the men who feed the wild sealions. They will get angry when you don't want to pay them for feeding. They are very rude and I felt very uncomfortable and unsafe when they were obviously talking about me in their own language. Municipality should get these old and drunk men away, because they ruin this beautiful place.
Nice boatride. We took an hour's ride out along the bay and saw seals and, unexpectedly, there were whales! It was beautiful scenery and very worthwhile!

Fish on the Rocks. Theres only one way to enjoy Hout Bay and thats to visit the world famous Fish on the Rocks that serves freshly fried hake and chips and an assortment of other delicacies. The views are breath-taking - just watch out for the seagulls that are in abundanceexcellent food 1

Wonderful seal tour. The seal tour out of hout bay was great. It was quite windy outside the harbour with a reasonable swell building but our skipper put the boat right against the rocks were the seals lie. An exciting trip and well worth the modest charge

Nice but crowded. Dec 27 afternoon: One of the many famous bays in CPT. We were on our way back from Groot Constantia. The beach was quite crowded. As is the case, this beach also has the mountains as a backdrop. Since, we had just done late lunch at Groot, we didn't get a chance to sit and relax at the restaurants.

Favourite. We just lve going to the beach at Hout Bay it's a lovely walk and you can stop off on,the way back to the pub on the beach called dunes good for a snack and a drink to quench your thirstOnly bad thing there is it can be very windy and the sand can go all over the place.The little shopping precinct is quaint with a few shops and a brilliant Woolworths similar to m&s .there is also a lovely chemist shop called,wheelers the people,are always ready to help with any problems and has a,good health department.
Breath. It’s a breath of fresh air; this is a great day trip and drive. Make sure you have a good camera and a good zoom you will need it!
houtbay. travel by taxi, bus or car as long as you go to hout bay, for swim for fish for fun, great deals at the fish market as well

Hout Bay, lovely drive and restaurants. The drive to Hout Bay from Cape Town is just SO beautiful. Lots of places to stop on the way to take photos and look at the sea. A walk on the little fisherman's harbour is a must and the restaurants there are outstanding!
Get off the Hop On Hop Off Bus at this stop. If you are taking the open top bus tour, jump off at the Hout Bay Stop. You may have to walk a bit, but be adventurous

Quick visit, but well worth it.. Stopped off for lunch on the way from Cape Town to Stellenbosch. The weather was perfect which probably helped. Took a walk along the beach and then the harbour where you get to see the sea lions. There was a man sitting on the sea wall feeding them fish from his mouth which was quite an interesting sight!

Less touristy and more realistic. . It is not the million dollar playground of Camps Bay, and retains real world charm with its harbour and fishing fleet. Hout Bay is a place to experience pre-touristy Cape Town. If ever the partying gets too much on the lavish side of the bay, it is definitely worth trekking here for a dose of reality.
beautiful and Quaint. Loved Hout Bay.....lovely quaint little town. Ok was seriously a cold rainy day but walking along the pier and watching the boats was pretty peaceful.
Very scenic place. The Hout Bay is a very scenic place with views of the Table Mountain. Offers restaurants, shopping experiences...

Popular place for visitors. nice seafood restaurant to visit interesting market stalls to see. great souvenirs to buy at the shops. The Bokkoms nice and tasty well vacuumed pack to buy and take home. lot of boat trips to take

Beautiful place. Take the inexpensive 45 minute boat ride to seal island! Hundreds of seals basking in large rocks. The town is charming - wish we could've spent more time there. Plenty of shops and a picturesque marina. The view of Hout Bay from Chapmans Peak Drive is stunning.

Beautiful Experience. Today we went to Hout Bay and took a boat over to see the seal colonies. The drive out was gorgeous, very scenic with lots of beautiful homes to look at. We arrived and at the harbour and purchased tickets from Drumbeat Charters for the seal colonies. You should bring cash because they do not have a credit card swipe there. It was reasonable. For 2 adults and three children we paid a little over R600,00. We went out on a medium sized vessel. It was clean and safe. There is an inside cabin with a bar and for those who want to there is an area in the front of the boat to ride outside in the open air. It is pretty choppy an dhilly in the winter. My son gets motion/sea sickness but he did just fine on the inside of the vessel. There are little stands on the pier to purchase gifts but I thought they were a bit expensive. The people were a bit pushy but overall it was a great experience. We got so close to the seals, it was amazing. They were chatting and playing with one another...amazing. I would recommend a trip out there.

Approach from Chapmans Peak, stunning!!. Approach from Chapmans Peak, stunning!! Beautiful bay with long sandy beach. Great day out with interesting working harbour, several nice restaurants and market, well worth a visit.

Great place to visit enjoy and grab a bite to eat. Great Bay with lots of things to do other than enjoy the great scenery and nice beach.Harbour is lovely and you can get a boat tour to see seals at Seal rock for I think 80 rand boats leave about every 15 minutes.Depending on weather at the docks they have an arts and craft market and seals that you can take photos with of course for a fee.Multiple places to eat at all price levels and also areas for drinks/coffee.Further down the road great views looking down on Bay.
It was little cloudy that that. But the view was breath taking. We had a driver and made the whole drive. If you have clear day, the views are breath taking.
Best kingklip ever.. During our stay in Cape Town we went for "fish and chips" at Houtbay. The four of us enjoyed "baby kingklip" THE BEST !!!!!

Must see in Cape Town . Hout Bay is a beautiful place and worth a visit! We had delicious fish/calamari and chips there! There is a stunning view of Chapman's Peak. And you can walk about the harbour and even see some seals! There is also a beach. I always return!

Hout Bay - An absolute must as a visit. So, if you are an adventurer who loves the small, quaint town feel, with a huge heart, then this is a definite stop. The shops are really gorgeous, the fish and chips and extensive menu for any taste, a delightful experience to enjoy, whilst watching the seagulls circle overhead and people frollick in the gentle waters off this most beautiful bay surrounded by majestic mountains. I love the curio shops as this is one off the fun places you can buy a Hout Bay Passport.. :) Oh, don't forget to buy a live oyster in a can or a string off fresh water pearls for your loved ones. There is so much to see here. I love the tranquillity of this harbour too.

Chapman's Peak Drive . This is a beautiful scenic route south of Hout Bay. I enjoy this area most in the late afternoon, with the sun in the west, this is just a perfect light for pictures. This is a toll road but well spent money. I was lucky to see a couple of whales in the bay. When you travel here you should take your time and stop as often as possible. Along the route there are a couple of spots ideal to park the car and walk around. In Hout Bay there are many attractions and restaurants. A beautiful little town.
Turquoise sea. A fabulous day out. Bit of a drive but the views are stunning and watch out for wildlife. The bluest sea ever.

Western Cape. Hout Bay offers a cooling breeze and spectacular views over the deep turquoise bay and mountains behind. There is a lovely harbour where you can take a boat and see the Seals Island. On your way back to the car park, there are many arts and crafts places - in case you want to buy some cheap souvenirs-. Best of all, it is a proper town in its own right, peaceful, clean with a nice and pleasant sandy beach.

Stunning Chapmans Peak drive.... We usually go every so often to gout bay via Chapmans Peak drive. It's definitely one of the most scenic drives in the world! Hout bay is always beautiful and a lovely experience. As always when visiting Hout Bay, fish and chips is a must at Mariner's Warf!
Vacation in South Africa. Hout bay was our start point for going to the seal island. Boats come down to the bay to get repairs

Make sure you visit the Harbour area. Years ago Hout Bay was 'the' place to visit. These days is a different story, however a visit to the harbour is still good. Go hungry and have fresh fish at 'on the rocks' or at 'snoekies'.
A quick stop to see African penguins . The place just has a lot of penguins. Cute and small. Beyond that there is nothing else. Kids will enjoy.

OMG BEAUTIFUL. this was simply amazing to do. take a jacket as it does get windy and chilly. but the views here are paradise for people who love photography. the drive down to this place is as beautiful. grab a bite or take some snacks with you if you have kids. love this place.
Summer 2015. Lovely town with loads of history and enjoyable visit and amazing fish and chips on the rocks will visit again
Windy boat trip. On a wintry morning with about 5 degrees Celsius weather, we set out at Hout Bay. It was cold but since we come from a tropical country, we enjoyed the adventure.

Beautiful scenery. A pretty beach area outside of C.T. Worth the ride along the coast line to get there. I went on an organised trip but transport is available to do your own thing. Recommend a fine day

Had lunch here. Ate at Mariners Wharf which was delicious. Overlooks beach and marina. An entrepreneurial guy was enticing a large seal onto the dock where we could touch him and they fed him. The view was spectacular and we watched as the fog rolled in. Got real chilly on the restaurant deck after that. A long drive but worth it.

Quaint fishing village . Great little town to visit. Best to concentrate on the beach & harbour area. Not the best swimming beach, but fantastic for walking/jogging. Some great eateries around. Snoekies or Fish on the Rocks for delicious fish & chips....both frequented by the locals. A cruise to Duiker Island to see the seals is also worthwhile. The Chapmans Peak hotel serves the BEST calamari, whilst Dunes restaurant is the perfect spot for a long lazy lunch on a sunny afternoon....also great restaurant for children with a play area.
Beautiful Drive: Hout Bay. I had the opportunity to drive through Hout Bay and it was honestly the most beautiful view I have ever seen! I hope to stop there sometime soon!
nice fish. friendly people with nice atmosphere. nice markets to find different items. would reccomend for others
An interesting place. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this quaint little fishing village. The drive there is really scenic and well worth the effort.
Quiet Beauty. This beach town is very quiet and less of a tourist hangout. It was quite beautiful and still reflects a lot of its historic Dutch and German influence in its architecture.

Seafood and Seals. Great place for a day out of Cape Town. We enjoyed the sandy beach and an excellent lunch on the wharf. Seal cruises leave regularly from here and to make it really easy the red tour bus stops here too.

Great town on Atlantic coast Cape Town. Fantastic place to visit and on main tourist route. Village atmosphere in places surrounded by disadvantaged squatter-camps and disadvantaged communities in part. Town itself prosperous. Beautiful beach albeit sometimes polluted. Great restaurants and pubs. Good schools. Can be accessed from City, Comstantia side and famous Chapmans Peak drive. Also over mountain. Helicopter in if you can afford it. Can be walked to from Sandy Bay but take care. A long way and sometimes risky. Highly recommended place to visit. Good shops and supermarkets. Banks. Served by some public transport.
Serene and pretty. Enjoyed seafood lunch here - lovely views, great local shops to wander around in, pretty and relaxing day.

Nice beach, interesting indoor market. Worth a visit, there is a nice little beach and a busy harbour area.Mariner's Wharf offers coffees and meals which are OK. A short walk away is the indoor market which is well worth a visit. A selection of stalls selling local products, hair braiding and feathers, great food and coffee.The outdoor touristy market is what it is, if thats what you are looking for. Nearby drive through Chapman's Peak is beautiful.Also, trips to Seal Island leave from Hout Bay - it's an interesting little trip.
Beautiful . Beautiful beach side restaurants, a busy little harbour, scenic mountainside and eyes opening township tours can all be enjoyed in Houtbay.

Hout Bay. Lovely for a day trip and a lot to do in Hout Bay. You can just walk around in the harbor, buying souvenirs, eat some fish and chips and take a boat trip to rob island.
You can also visit World of birds, although last time I was there it was quite outdated with very little variety of bird species.

Smell the ocean.. Hout Bay is well known for it's good fish & chip eateries - Fish on the Rocks, Fisherman's Wharf, The Look Out & our favourite Snoekies - all quite good. A walk on the Harbour is interesting when the fishermen come in with their catch of the day. Lots of stalls selling goods hand-made by the Africans and there's also a weekend craft market - lots of things on sale and lots of different food stalls. Also a popular Tourist attraction.
Beautiful bay. A bit too cold for swimming when we were there but a beautiful to beach to walk around. Really lovely views looking across to Hout Bay from the road on the other side of the Bay.

a safe bet. Having traveled Chapmans Peak over 100 times in my lifetime..it still thrills...Hout Bay remains a favorite.....all roads traveling in and out all offer interesting views and scenery, remains a great showcase for the Mother City...the harbour eateries and markets all offer up something special....a great visit during the winter months~
Lovely Market. Worth a trip to hout bay... not as busy as Cape Town and a fab market to visit to purchase local crafts.Try it
BEAUTIFUL!. We absolutely loved this place. Beautiful. Enjoy a nice glass of rose and some fish and chips along the water.
Beautiful but touristy.. Beautiful views but very touristy. Take a nice ferry ride from here to Seal Island. One of those visit once is enough places for me.

Magnificent. No visit to Cape Town is complete without visiting Hout Bay. Even getting there is an absolute treat as you wind your way along Chapman's Peak Drive. Hout Bay has a village feel with lots of quaint coffee shops and farm market stalls. The Fish Market is a treat and a stroll along the harbor is sure to delight. We saw seals everywhere and even took a boat to Seal Island. Very affordable at around £15 each
Beautiful. Always beautiful to visit Hout Bay - great for photographs and love the old world shops - and the weather is always nice
Houtbay is stunning.. What a beautiful town Houtbay is. Stunning white sand beaches, blue sea! Then you can feed seagulls and seals. We had lunch at Houtbays restaurant, it was delicious.

Great place - go swimming with seals!. Lovely place. Easy to get to from cape town in an uber. We went swimming with seals which I would highly recommend. Found a nice little cafe with free wifi in the shopping mall area.
Must see. The beautiful and lush green tree lined streets, the drive up Chapmans Peak and eating at Snoekies makes this a must visit.

Mariners wharf. for a cold rainy day, excellent choice for lunch
great atmosphere, heated. delicious fresh fish & prawns. obliging waiter when I asked for 1 of the disposable place mats as a souvenir.

The Mariners Wharf restaurant . We always stop here at least once for lunch, more often twice. Food is absolutely delicious. Service is good even on busy days. View extraordinary. Prawns Kingfisher out of this world.

Hop off the red bus. The Saturday market is amazing. Great vibe. Lunch at Snoekies was delicious. See the seals being hand fed at the Harbour. What a beautiful sight to see the colorful boats in the harbor. We always hop off the red bus at Hout Bay.

Nice stop on way up to Chapman's Peak. Nice quaint place to stop and stretch your legs (maybe have a bite) on your way from Cape Town up to Chapman's Peak and beyond. Everybody in our group of 7 is from the west coast of the USA and all have seen seals. We took the 45-min boat ride to see Seal Island but later agreed that we could have skipped it.

Hout Bay- Seal Island Cruise and Local Shopping-Must visit. Visited Hout bay as this is the place to board the cruise to reach Seal Island and watch lion seals off the coast breeding.Nice views of harbour and yatch docks, gulls too. this is a must visit place to shop/buy local stuff (very important) and get differntly designed handicrafts and fossils and at great deals and offers.
Hour bay Cape Town. This is an amazing drive along the coast. Stop and get some fish and chips at Hout Bay and see the seals and fishing boats.

Fun city! . Hout Bay is the type of town where I want to retire. Make sure to check out the restaurant at the Cape Point Hotel and walk around the Hout Bay Market. There's a beach and pier and you can just wander and relax.

Perfect day out. Brought my daughter with me on a business trip. Had to show her around and what a pleasure Hout Bay was. Sea food lunch and walk along the harbor was great to relax and just talk. If in Cape Town don't leave without visiting.

Lunch at Chapmans Peak Hotel.. This is a great day out! Take a drive along Chapman's Peak Drive and stop for lunch at Chapman's Peak Hotel. The view is amazing and the food is beyond delicious. The calamari served in the pan is a must! You can visit the wine cellar and choose your own wine or enjoy numerous beers on tap. Continue the drive past Simon's Town and onto the Cape Point Nature Reserve. Really, really worth it!
Good midway stop. Good place to take a seal tour, buy wooden trinkets. Maybe 1.5 hours tops. Bathrooms are on the far left (if you're facing the bay)
Pretty fishing town. Physically beautiful place but not much of a town, mostly fishing boats and a cannery....the market here was quite nice....

Craft and Seals. The resto on the beach reminded me of the Bush Tavern here in uMdhloti (Durban). only a reminder because of the wooden deck and eating area. Hout Bay has more to offer. A walk down the pier, chatting to local fishermen and listening to them explain how they go cray/lobster fishing in their "junks"was informatively interesting. met with a local who was making money having befriended a "wild"seal and using the seal as tourist attraction was scarily exciting for me. I know better than to get up close to a wild seal! the local Craft Brewery is an excellent stop over to quench one's thirst. Their ciders are unique! If you lucky like me - Jeffery would be happy to take you through the processes of how he makes his beers. Ask nicely! The Friday evening flea market is a definite place to hang out with locals - being early winter and already very chilly by Durban standards - the fireplace, food and wine are a big draw card. How the day/evening passed so quickly...it was time to leave but not without the cray fish tails we had bought earlier in the day.

ENJOYABLE OUTING. Great for a stroll around the working fishing harbour. Many small tourist stalls, which tend to be a bit of a trap. Do drive further to the original Snoekies for legendary fish and chips.
hidden gem. Lovely little bay, which is very picturesque. We visited here on a friday and alsk went to the market which is on fridays 4.30 till late.

Boat trip to seagulls. Fantastic place to do a boat trip. Some hours at sea and definitely a sight at a group of seagulls. We also got a view on a big whale while we were heading to the seagull living. Beautiful sight on the coast with the high rocks. And returning in the harbour: live south african music to welcome us back.

must see seals & cruise at hout bay is awesome.....recommend for visit. must see seals & cruise at hout bay is awesome.....recommend for visit.the boat ride which we had was beyond imagination as the sea was rough & it just jumped....nice to watch the colony of seals at the mid island.
Lovely scenery. Beautiful weather great scenery saw some beautiful penguins at close quarters. Could spend a whole day viewing them.
Good for a quick visit. Hout Bay is best viewed from across the bay to take in its beauty. It's a little grubby in that area, but a trip to Fish on the Rocks is a must!

Stunning views and a great place for Fish and Chips. I never tire of going to Hout bay! Its great to go there for a walk a long the harbour wall and to see the rusting boats and the seals performing. One of the main attractions is the excellent fish and chips sold there.

Sunday afternoon activity. The beach at Hout Bay is nice to enjoy on a windless or mildly breezy day. Have some calamari and chips or whatever fish you like when the salty air hits you and you get hungry. See the antics of Norman and Nicholas the seals as their trainer feeds them while you take pics of them. You can feed them too,by the way.They are only two of the many amazing seals that inhabit the waters nearby. It's always windy here so definitely take along a jacket. The weather changes quickly to cloudy so you have to be prepared.
Sun Sea and Sand. Fantastic place, great coastal drive to and from the bay. One of best fish and chips in CPT. Nice and relaxing

Just Beautiful. Oh how the shanty seafarers of the past were so lucky to drop anchor at this beautiful harbour and port and have left us a living legacy of a working fishing port with a beautiful little beach, superb restaurants, excellent seal diving trips and that old world feel that time has stood still a little.

Beautiful beach. Awesome day spent having lunch at Hout Bay ,Enjoyed walking on the docks,feeding the seals and watching the fisherman unloading their boats of the days catch.a must if you enjoy lekker fish and chips and just want a chillied day.

Special town. I have been going to Houtbay for many years and even though the town has expanded hugely, it still retains a feel of a little coastal town. There are so many things to do and include the harbour, cruises and a multitude of great restaurants to fit everyones budget.
Cool place!. Getting there might be an amazing experience taking the Chapman's Pass. Breath taking views and stunning scenery will take you to Hout Bay.

Amazing view. Hout Bay is beautiful place. Ocean view are simply amazing. Tourist location great for seal and whale boat tour. Recommend to visit local art craft and to try fresh seafood, Loved this place! Hope back soon!

Fabulous. This is truly a lovely Town. Great walks along the promenade with an ice cream. Lunch or dinner or about trip out followed by a stroll past the African markets makes this a great afternoon out.

Beautiful!. I visited the Hout Bay during my recent trip to Cape Town. A lovely bay that is home to what was once a busy fishing port. There is an excellent restaurant here which sits atop the bay and offers wonderful views across the water. Excellent
amzaing boat ride. a real good experience of CERSI BOAT to seal island, friendly staff. street perfornamce by local artists
Seals! Seals! Seals!. Friends and I had private boat and loved our boat ride which was calm and enjoyable with great sights along the way to see the seals. Some shopping and restroom stops nearby.

"Houted" out. What a lovely place.....beautiful beach, loads of very good restaurants, and right by Chapman's Peak- one of the most scenic routes in the world. Plenty to do here including the World of Birds: visiting Mandela Park Township for a tour (ask for Africa Moni as he lives there and is hugely knowledgeable as well as entertaining); visiting the Original Tea Bags workshop and shop - local people make all sorts of products from used tea bags including coasters, handbags, trays, cards, wildlife pictures etc; and, if you are there on the weekend, you must visit Hout Bay crafts which is at the end of the docks....it is undercover and has a vast supply of crafts as well as loads of interesting food outlets with enough options to suit everyone....fabulous village to visit...

Beautiful and buzzing Hout Bay. I always love to go to Hout Bay, as it is such a beautiful place to visit We went there on Saturday afternoon and the place was buzzing. There were some fishermen who feed the seals and the seals were tame and friendly.You could touch them and take photos. We had a bite at the Bistro Wharfette Mariner's Wharf and feed the seabirds afterwards with the left over chips. For a beautiful and relaxing Saturday afternoon Hout Bay is the place to go to.

Ok place if you want to get out of Cape Town for a bit. A bunch of us drove down to Hout Bay to check it out. There's not much to see honestly. We checked out the fish and chips place near the water and went grocery shopping. Otherwise, there was nothing much else to do. The fish and chips are average. If you don't have much time on your trip, stick with Cape Town and enjoy the sights there first.
Friendly vissit. A must is Fish on the rocks. Houtbay has its own flavour. It is such a nice place you just want to stay there. The restaurants are tops. Food is fresh. Friendly ppl everywhere.
beatiful views. Took a bus tour an one of the stops was Hout Bay, the day was sunny and the view was easily one of the top views I have ever seen.
Simply Stunning Views. Take a ride to Hout Bay, an easy drive from Cape Town proper. Stunning views along the way and spectacular landscape.

Old charming fisherman town - worth a visit. Old fisherman town. Stunning bay with a very cosy little harbour, where you can get fantastic (and cheap seafood). If you have tickets for the hop-on hop-off bus, then it stops here, and it is worth getting off and get a little snack or lunch, shop at the market and just watch the breathtaking view.

Stunning harbour with a magical beach and mountain views.. Turquoise water with a white beach. Outstanding seafood restaurants. Its like a beautiful painting with all the boats in the little bay. 2 Big seals entertaining the crowds in the bay. A must to experience.

A bit of paradise. We were riding the tour bus and had just come from the backside of Table Mountain. We needed a break and the Bay hit the spot. Delightful beach with a variety of swimmers, dog walkers and tourists is coupled with fishing boats. If it had been warmer and if we had our fishing gear, we would have stayed for hours.
Beach. It is a lovely Bay but I was expecting more.. touristy and not much to see apart from the beach. There is a market at the weekend which is fun to visit.

Very scenic. Really scenic place with stunning views, especially on a clear day. Has a couple of great and very reasonably priced restaurants to enjoy great fish and chips. Also, one may be able to see seals swimming in the water.
A place where dwellers differ in attitude.. Had lunch while visiting and learnt about the story of the Hout bay Republic. Most interesting. Good sightseeing nearby.

Take your camera. Hout Bay has the kind of unreal vistas you usually only see on jigsaw puzzles. The best way to get there initially is on the hop on, hop off bus. Take your camera, and be prepared to take photos nonstop. It's difficult to take a bad picture at Hout Bay. Trip was actually in November 2013, not 2015. Second trip to Hout Bay. First was in 2006.
Beautiful Place. I went here while I was in Cape Town and loved it more every time I was there. Make sure to walk along the beach or take a seal island boat cruise if you happen to stop by.

Charming town with great views. Did a sundowner here with friends. Amazing well kept, clean areas for picnics and fun times. Gorgeous views. Excellent beaches and super friendly people. A must if you are in the area.

Absolutely Awesome. This place will definitely be on my list of go again. It's the cleanest town I've seen in a long time. No paper at all, white beach, friendly people. Restaurants on the seaside. Absolutely awesome!!

quaint and idyllic. This fishing harbour is still as quaint and lovable as I remember long ago.You have to eat FISH here.The beach makes for post card pictures,there are tourists and the place is memorable
stunning view. the place is extremely nice scenery with excellent spots for photos not easily transported to you need a car but the view really deserve it

Fun little stop on hop on hop off bus. Stopped and took pictures. Definitely do the otter cruise ...45min and awesome to see the otters in their natural habitat. Just make sure you don't miss your bus like we did.

Walk on The Harbor and surprise market. Surprise as It was evening market on The Harbor, this is a must do.
The rest of The city is just ok, few minutes from capetown, which is Perfect.
To get there or to cape point we used a magnifique road just on The edge of The coast.

A place showing Cape Twon another way. Good fish restaurants and a market where fresh fish arrives everyday.
Seals are playing around and from the terrace of the restaurant you watch ships and the beach.

Argus cycle tour mania 2016. Cycling in an event that I had taken my small children to watch was a wonderfully exhilarating experience- and cycling through the 'Republic' of Hout Bay and witnessing the crowds and the ambience was awesome
Nice spot in CT. Nice place to visit. I made some beautiful pictures there and I enjoyed the ride. The views are worth it.
Look out for the seals. Great way to spend half a day. This bay has a lovely coastline and harbor. Watch the seals on the shore line and enjoy a meal in one of the restarants

Great viewing. Nice harbour from where you can do a boattrip to Duiker Island, a seal island. You can also have a stroll at the local market or take a walk in the white sand beach!Tip: drive up on Chapmans Peak. It's a beautiful road with oceanview all along. Also you will have gorgeous view on Hout Bay from one of the parkinglots on Chapmans Peak!
Hout Bay hotel . We never have a visit without spending time on the terrace having some fine seafood. Don't miss visiting this place for a great lunch or evening.
Authentic fishermen's bay. Don't miss Houtbay. Not as glam as campsbay but this realMight see some sealions! Seefood everywhere, like fisherboats.

beautiful but try a sunny day. I visited this place on a cloudy, windy day.. enjoyed the place and the boat ride to the seals' rock but it was a bit rough . would recommend the ride on a sunny day - or at least with quieter winds
Neat place with flea market. Nice place with market on the weekends. Eclectic food and a touristy boat which sails out to an island to watch sea lions.

Clean beach. Busy little marina, beach is so clean, but not busy....watch the waves. I toom a walk along ghe water edge having a wee paddle, all was smooththen woosh .way up ovdr my knees and pretth strong.but fun.
Use the red bus services, runs evert 20 min

A must for visitors to Cape Town. I live nearby and go often for the best fish and chips at Mariner's Wharf bistro on the quayside-at weekend The bay harbour market has a great vibe with food, music and lots of stalls
Beautiful Harbour. Underrated in the winter months for a stroll with beautiful views and the beach although too cold to swim, is excellent.
BEST FISH & CHIPS EVER!. We had lunch at the fish on the rocks restaurant & it was by far the most delicious fish & chips I had ever had!

Well worth a visit. Stopped off for a few hours while on long journey. This is a lovely spot, beautifully situated, ringed by mountains, a sheltered bay. Enjoyed the old guy and his trained seal. There are shops selling curios, fishing boats being unloaded and all the atmosphere of a small busy port.

Stunning!. Beautiful place to drive to to escape Cape Town. Lovely coastline with some nice places to stop off along the way, really easy to get to if you hire a car and just get going! Would highly recommend to all

Shop around. Bout Bay,is such a lovely place.We call it the Republic of Bout Bay.It has a lovely beach,with sand dunes. The drive along Chapman's Peak is just beautiful.If ur in a hired car, don't forget you pay a toll.There is a lovely mall & shops near the beach.Then on the other side is the village,with a great assortment of restaurants.At the harbour is, Mariners Wharf.Great fish & chips,small shop that sells fish ,a bottle store & shell shop.Here u can feed the seals.There are some huge boats here. Some do trips.There is a fresh fish market where you can buy fresh fish.(snoek& yellow tail) are very nice.There is plenty of parking. The hop on off bus also goes here.There are African stalls here.Barter please.Then there is the lighthouse,which is called the "Lookout Deck".You can watch the seals here while you eat.Further on there is a great indoor market that sells a variety of food,clothes & ornaments. There is a live band,but parking is limited.Also another great fish & chip shop & ice cream shop

UNSPOILED BEAUTY. Just loved Hout Bay, with a beautiful beach, framed by magestic mountains, walk along the promenade and see all the fishing boats, you might be lucky and see seals too, have fresh fish and chips at Marinas Wharf. All in all an enjoyable experience.
Hout Bay. Beautiful scenery and nice downtown. The ocean here is spectacular. Go on a clear day so that you can get the full impact.

Fantastic place to stay. I was lucky enough to be able to spend a month in the Hout Bay area. While I ventured all over the Cape, Hout Bay is a lovely, quiet area with some neat shops and good restaurants. It's also a quick hop to Claremont area, and the Chapman's Peak drive is great! Worth a visit or a stay.

Almost as good as Old Biscuite Mill. On Friday/Saturday/Sundays it is worth visiting if you like lots of people, relaxed environment and good food. Quite few shops with unusual handicraft too. IF you have been to Old Biscuite Mill and would like something similar.

BEST Fish and chips in town.. Without a doubt we would go to "Fishies" as we called it , every opportunity we got. Every time we came to Cape Town on holiday, one of the FIRST places we would go to would be HOUT BAY for fish and chips at Mariners Wharf. Now that we have retired and live here, we fine every excuse in the book to make the long trek to Hout Bay whenever we can. Its an institution. Although the prices have escalated a bit over the years, we still find it such good value and a lovely BIG box of fish and chips is always on the cards. FRESH from the sea, nothing could be better. In Crayfish season my husband treats himself as often as possible and more often than not he gets 2 tails in his box and occasionally even 3. Its a GREAT place and we will never tire of going there - summer or winter its always good.

Lovely stop along the way to Cape of Good Hope . We stopped in Hout Bay on a tour to Cape Point / Cape of Good Hope. This was a lovely spot with a few stall holders selling curios much cheaper than in Cape Town.

Great for seal island visit - but that's it. Boat trip to seal island (Duiker) is fab - but only guaranteed in the morning - other than that not a lot here - but we hopped off the hop on hop off bus so it was no drama

Lovely spot. Just outside busy Cape Town you find this lovely calm place which is probably perfect for a great seafood meal and indeed great photo options of the harbor area. there was also a a small marked at the harbor where you could buy handcrafts, and plenty of other stuff.

Best fish and chips!. If you're looking for the tastiest, freshest and most generous fish and chips in the country this is where you will find it. Be prepared to share, portions are big and well worth it. This is definitely the best!
Afternoon visit. Lovely drive along Chapmans peak. We bought fish and chips at Fish on the rocks in Houtbay and drove to Chapmans peak for a picnic!

Paradise in the gutter!. Hout Bay used to be beautiful, natural, peaceful and a must do and see for any visitor, but those days are gone. What is now a reality is an endless stream of unemployed beggars and 'help me - family of many to feed' board waiting at every traffic light, a sense of discarded sadness and littered fear, overflowing from the Brazil-like squatter camp called Imizamo Yethu that now dominates the once quaint village of Hout Bay. Getting there from Cape Town or the Southern suburbs: The narrow Constantia Nek road is a time consuming nightmare, should you have the frequent misfortune to be stuck behind a truck or bus. If possible, use the scenic Chapman's Peak Drive (there is a toll imposed on using this road) or use Victoria Road (M6) from town via Camps Bay.The harbour is still functioning with its array of seafood delights and friendly seals. The fishing boats still come and go, but Hout Bay is a polluted former paradise where all the roses that grow have very sharp thorns indeed!

Seals, Seafood and the Seashore. If you're heading to Hout Bay, then you're pretty much heading to the bay area where Mariner's Wharf offers the best seafood in the area. Take a walk down the "dock" past the seals and their unofficial trainers who for a donation make the seals do some tricks. Down to the right past Mariners Wharf is a small "Market" with African-style tourism curios but it's also the area to go if you are wanting to go to Seal Island or on a glass bottom boat. It's a truly lovely area to go to for a short adventure!

Beautiful part of the world. We popped by on our way to the Cape of Good Hope. We also got to see the beautiful scenic bay as we drove up Chapman’s Peak Drive. It was a little misty when we visited but it would be a very pretty bay on a sunny day.

Super Trip out the City. Great to leave the City and travel to Hout Bay where you will find Glass Bottom Boat Trips and Boat Trips to the Seal Colony for sensible prices ZAR50-70 per person.Nice Little craft and souvenirs stall plus a Fantastic Vendor selling Shark Tooth Fossils from Madagascar. Also make a day of it by Eating some fine LOCAL FOOD and taking a walk along the beach.
A good place to see. Great scenery and eateries near the shore. The harbour is the place to go to catch a trip to Seal Island.

Hout Bay - Gem of Cape Town. A visit to cape Town without visiting Houtbay is like going to horse farm and not riding a horse. Cape town is the farm and Houtbay is the horse. Go there and experience a scenic wonderland not to mention the colourful locals. Good, fresh, fish is to be had that will blow your socks off. Bring your cameras, hats and walking shoes. Don't forget that bottle of water either. With good eateries and hotels you wont be disappointed. Enjoy this bit of paradise.

Fascinating place. Took off from this harbor to visit the Seal island. But the seals were already performing for us on the harbor before the boat arrived. Those selas.were great! There was a flea market that offered many items- souvenirs and.curios and we were happy to haggle. The boats on the dock were nice to look at and.were picture pretty.

Freshest fish ever. Hout bay is a harbour community known for its fresh fish and slaap chips (french fries). Anything fresher that the fish served in hout bay is still swimming in the ocean! The prices are not to bad either!
there are better beach towns. a run of the mill beach town with the big attraction is the boats going out to seal island. The boats get very crowded

Day outing. This is the best day out destination. Taking a long walk after indulging in the black mussels at Mariners Wharf is a must. The Harbour is the most interesting spot. A Soft serve in the harbour is the cherry on top.

Lazy Sunday Drives. If you are in Cape Town Surrounds, it would be worth it to take a drive to Hout Bay to enjoy the beautiful scenery as well as the local vibe. Hout Bay is famous for its harbour area and boat trips to Seal Island. Lately it has also become known for the great market they have at the end of the industrial road (dead end). The market has upmarket good and great food to eat. It is open over weekends and the vibe is lively and friendly. Hout Bay is also well known for Chapman's Peak Drive - a stunning coastal drive that will take your breathe away. Make sure you plan that into your trip. They also have the World of Birds - I have not been there for years, but I do hear it is good. There are also hikes around Hout Bay that you can do. Beautiful nature all around.
A stop on our way to Cape POint. Hout Bay is a stop on the tour to Cape Point from Cape Town. It is a small fishing village. The point where the tour bus stops is lines with locals selling crafts.
Good stop for seafood and look at the Seals. It is a good place to stop for having seafood, chill out and just looking at the seals . It is quite pleasant and lovely place
Very pretty local spot to stop off and enjoy vistas & a coffee. Ex fishing town, some mariner history, pretty beach for swimming although the water is freezing all year round.

Great day trip to see a different view of the cape.. Beautiful area - you can take a boat out to see the seals on the rocks close to the magnificent cliff. Small curios and live music make the day a nice touch.
Pretty bay. The bay itself is very picturesque, set amongst tall mountains. The ferry to nearby seal island departs from the harbor here, where you can see the colony of wild Cape Fur Seals.

Loved it. Drove to Hout Bay. Parking available. Did the Seal Island trip. Very nice. Managed a few good pics. Lovely restaurant, Lots of african curio stalls infront of the boats with reasonable prices.
Beautiful . A must see when in Cape Town, its own life style and atmosphere. Wonderful food and accommodation, no wonder the locals say you need a passport to visit.

Beautiful place. You have to visit this wonderful bay. It is really hard describe how wonderful is this place.. The landscape is beautiful. Along the way it is possible to stop in really nice small town to eat something tipical.
Nice . My family and I have been to Houston Bay a few times. I love the restaurants and the beach. You spot seals and dolphins there regularly. You also leave for seal island tours from there.
Good food on the wharf . Not as nice of a town as Camps bay, nor as nice of a beach. But great stop for fresh food on the wharf. And nice drive out there.

Get the camera ready. this picture perfect bay is just incredible and within 30 minutes of beautiful cape town itself. The area is easily accessed by road and various points for photo stops are easily identified. Take some time to soak up the ambience of this special area, memorable photo stop and the gate way to the south towards Cape Point. Just Gorgeous.

OK. Its OK, best part is the Chapmans peak road to get there. Awesome views. The beach is ok. Was not impressed with a local fisherman feeding and interacting with a wild sea lion to attract visitors taking pictures and earn some tips. Surely this has to be illegal? Feeding wild animals is never a good thing.
A beautiful bay. Hout Bay is such a pretty spot. There is a working harbour, lots of shops and a beautiful beach. Don't miss it when in the Cape.
boat ride. boat ride seen penguins and seals took photos and lovely scenery and mountains all round very good for all travellers visiting Capetown not tobe missed

Unique in every little way..... Not only does the people of the community add to the ambiance of the small town but the setting is so unique. When you visit Hout Bay remember to have a piece of Snoek that was prepared on the braaier and visit the local shops for souvenirs.
A must do scenic drive.. Only a short drive outside of Camp's Bay is this beautiful scenic route and on a sunny day, the emerald water is just mesmerising.

good for a short stopover - exquisite views. on our way back from chapman's drive we asked our guide to stop for a little while at the hout bay - just to take in the sheer beauty of it. it is incredible. while we dint really stay there too long or head into the water, the area is beautiful and provides many photo opportunities
Hout Bay market. We went to the market on a Saturday and had a great morning - lots of variety in the food dept and great craft beer. It's has a nice feel and is very clean including the loo's
Fun visit. Great place to head to for great fish and chips and to watch the catch of the day come in on the fishing boats.. very chilled
Gorgeous!. Breathtakingly beautiful including the drive. Go with knowledgeable guide because there is so much history. Rivals Big Sur in California!

Picturesque!. Stopped here on our way to Chapmans Peak Drive, to have a walk round the lovely little market down by the dock. Lovely picturesque place. Got a great view of the bay later on as well when we drove up CPD.

Fantastic views. Drive on Chapmans drive and enjoy the fantastic views over Hout Bay. Did not stay in Hout bay itself but the view over the bay was fantastic as we drove along the coast on our way to Cape Point.

Best fish and chips!. The beach area in Hout Bay is white and beautiful but we always go to there for the Fish and Chips being served at the Harbour restaurants. It is a bit of a wait but definitely worth it.
Quirkiness with views. Off the beaten track with some spectacular views and the old harbour. Hout Bay offers a bit of schick with a lot of quirky.
Beautiful. We went for the seal island boat ride. WOW - there were hundreds of seals. We also saw a whale and watched kids on the docks feed the seals.

A nice place to vusut. You can go on the Seal island trip from here. The harbour is quirky with great sea food places and we saw sea fishing trips too. It's a nice place to visit if you desperate for things to do.

Seal Island Boat Trip. Took a boat from Hout Bay for Seal Island
Entertained by a handler and some seals on the docks whilst we were waiting to board and then whilst waiting to leave the harbour as well.

A great place to chill out for half a day.. Only a short distance from Cape Town city, perhaps 30 minutes by car; it is also accessible with the Red 'Hop on Hop Off' bus. Be sure to turn right off the main road which leads to an interesting harbour where the seals are tempted by local fishermen to come up to the jetty. Small tourist shops selling locally sourced gifts are friendly and not 'pushy'. The Mariners Wharf fish restaurant is tops and overlooks a lovely beach.

Beautiful trip to the Cape. If you are not used to driving on the left side of the road, hire a driver to take you around the peninsula, catching the sunset on the west side to see the sun set over the Atlantic. A beautiful trip.
Very nice and layback . A stop is well worth it, the town is good for stop over and have coffee or drinkThe fish is very fresh around here and few very nice houses is around

Lovely bay with a lovely beach but not a must if you don't have time. Visited Hout Bay on a drive of the coastal path from Cape Town and was expecting big things from what other people told us. We got there around 4pm and although it was a bit chilly and windy, it was still beautiful. Walked along the jetty and saw a guy feeding seals, and loads of boats docked. There are some good restaurants and a shop to purchase seafood and wine. Overall, a nice stop, but not a must if you don't have time - I think it's slightly overhyped.
Gorgeous view!. We loved Hout Bay and the market! Stunning view, and the drive to view from Chapman's Peak cannot be beat.
Lovely spot great to stop off and have some lunch. Driving around the peninsular with some stunning view and Hout Bay is a picturesque place with plenty of cafe's to have a relaxing lunch

Amazing ride from Camps Bay. Be sure to get up early to beat the heat, wind and crowds and ride to Hout Bay past Cambs Bay and Llandudno. It's awesome and there's plenty of spots to grab a coffee on the other side.

Walk on the beach. Lovely setting for a pre lunch walk on the beach and a post lunch stroll to digest. The cleanliness of the bay was unacceptable and no attempt was being made to clean up the debris. There was a very smelly "lagoon" area which I presume is normally washed by a river. There were far too many dogs on the beach with irresponsible owneres who had no intention of cleaning up after them. A lovely spot being allowed to deteriorate by local authority it seems.

A great afternoon trip. We spent the afternoon at Hout bay enjoying the bay scenery as well as the fresh fish and chips available at Snookies, Mariners Warf and Fish on the Rocks. You are spoilt for choice as all offer fresh fish, calamari and prawns.There are also little curio stands with locally made items for sale behind the shops closer to the bay.There are also trips to seal island that can be taken from Hout bay as well as entertainment from Nicholas the seal for all to see.
Worth stopping at. You can read all the other reviews, I'll keep mine short. Beautiful place, relaxing vibes, would recommend.
Beautiful. Beautiful little Harbor with lots to see and do. Tours to the islands are cost effective and the restaurants are nice. The beggars were a bit irritating.
Sun and sand. Great beach on a sunny day. Great fish restaurant and bar, also boat ride and seals for entertainment.
Hour Bay stop on the Red Bus. Great place to hop off the red bus and stop to eat lunch. Great fish and chips. You can also enjoy the sandy beach if you have time.

Sightseeing and seafood. Hout bay overs spectacular views of the ocean and surrounds.
A day visit provides a scenic drive out to hout bay from the CBD area.
There are many fresh, delicious and value for money sea food restaurants in the area that are a must try
Really nice place to drop in for coffee. We stopped by for coffee, s we've done before in the past, and you can't help but admire the wonderful vies of the bay and surrounding landscape.
Beautiful Views. Wow , its totally amazing. The view from the top of Chapins Peak was breath taking. Simply amazing to drive up and see the view , smell the breeze and see the clearness of the ocean
The best place in the area!. Been coming here for 20 years love the views, the harbour, the markets and the restaurants which cater for every taste and budget

Quaint sea side town. Had a lovely drive over Chapman's Peak into Hout Bay. The Harbour Bay Market is a delightful, trendy market with loads of decent goodies to buy. Loads of different food stalls to wet your appetite.We ate traditional fish and chips from 'Fish on the Rocks' which was delicious and reasonably priced.You can walk up the harbour wall at Mariner's Wharf and for a donation can take a picture with a sea lion that the local fishermen feed. As with most venues in Cape Town, get there early as things heat and fill up quickly and you will have to queue the later you leave it

lots of boats and seals. lots of boats around and a ferry to take you out to the seal island. A word of caution beware the man who feeds the seals by the jetty to the boat trips, he ;doesn't like you taking photos of the seals unless you pay him, so you have to be a bit crafty. There are market stalls selling goods, some are very reasonable but you need to barter.
You should visit this place. From the seals and lively but lovely people in the bay, to the colors of the sea. This place is cool. Remember to do the sealtour.

Sandy beaches and surfing!. Great day for an outing close to the sea and watch the sea, boats, surfers and feel the wind! There are a few art galleries, one antique shop with a huge selection of maritime artifacts and fishing restaurants.
Fishing village vibe. This harbour has a real fishing village feel. lots of african handicrafts. ferry to seal island, high end restaurant such as mariners wharf and low end ones.
