Lovely beach. We were traveling from Chapman's peak and stopped at Hout Bay. It is located between roads and mountains, like Chapman's peak, nice sea view and there are a lot of restaurants to eat and enjoy the view.
A must go to see place. The seals experience in hout bay is a must... the way there is amazing, just rent a car and go there to enjoy a full outdoor day.

Catch live fish at hout bay harbour. The place is located in between historic roads and mountains ,like Chapman's peak,nice sea view and places to stop eat and enjoy the view.Get your friends and family and go explore the cape's peaks and nature reserves.

Lovely Place. We went to Hout Bay to go Tuna Fishing and got distracted by how pretty and friendly this little town is. The beach is lovely, the sea clean and there are plenty of nice restaurants. A lovely place to spend the day.

Restaurant Chapman Hotel. When in Cape Town a must is to visit Chappies for the best calamari prawns line fish portugese steak etc.Casual dining outside or in overlooking Hout Bay Beach.Best food in town!!!!

Enjoyed mariners wharf. Visited mariners wharf the food was good and the beach was beautiful, nice sight too. Enjoyed taking photos . There are shops and restaurants to go to good seafoods and shopping in this area.
A must if yiou wish to view the seals. As part of the peninsular tour , we stopped at Hout Bay. It is essential that you take the boat trip around the island to view the seals

Hout Bay Beach & Harbour. During our vacation in Cape Town we wished to spend some time at the beach. At first we thought about going to Camps Bay but we changed our mind. Although very picturesque, Camps Bay seemed a bit crowded every time we passed by it. Instead we decided to stop at Hout Bay. The sheltered bay of Hout Bay has a white sand beach which didn't look as crowded as Camps Bay. After enjoying a nice lunch at Mariners Wharf we spent some time on the white sand. Unfortunately the water was too cold for swimming. Right next to the beach is the pretty Hout Bay Harbour, still an active fishing harbour. From here you can take a boat ride to the Seal Island, a small rocky island where you can see plenty of fur seals. Hout Bay is a perfect spot for a lovely afternoon.

If u wanna swim and see seals thats the place. Beach is very good conditions sand and not so much windy. Also u have an opportunity to see seals which are placed so close islan to port. Also there are some of them in the port making some shows for tourist

Beautiful Bay. What a beautiful bay, great expansive beach overlooked by mountains. Take a walk along the beach and then head to the marina where you can meet Nicholas the seal. A truly South African experience
Beautiful . We have a flat here in Hout Bay its absolutely fantastic , plenty of restaurants in a very short distance , scenery second to none Very clean friendly place We visit time and time again
Hout Bay. If you love the beach, wind, sand, fish and chips an optional ferry tour to seal island, affordable local craft...you should be here.
Nice resort. The whole of Hout bay is wonderful, seafood restaurants and coffee places, and walking along the beach. Cape Town is indeed the mist beautiful city in the world.
Cape Town favorite fresh fish spot. Excellent place to have lunch lovely restaurants Cape Town favorites snoekies and fish on the rocks try the snoek
Seal island is brilliant. Very reasonably priced boat trip to see the Cape Furr Seals. Superb scenery and tons of seals, really lovely

Stunning beach. A breath taking beautiful beach. With a wide choice of restaurants and cafes just across the road there is something for every one. There were street performers dancing and traders selling African prints. We hopped off the sight seeing bus for lunch, wished we could have stayed longer.
Great Place. Had a great day , ,just hanging out in Hout Bay, Water is just beautiful . Had Lunch at the local Bar, worth going out there for the day

Gorgeous Beach. One of our favourite places. Use the car park on the right just before the Chapmans Peak road, kick off your shoes and walk the beach up to the harbour restaurant area where you can stop for a drink or a bite to eat before walking back. Only about one kilometre in each direction and if that is too much you can always stop off halfway along at The Dunes restaurant.

Magic. Being in Cape Town, you should go here to see the fantastic nature. You can go by boat to see the seal colony at Duiker Island. Most important, go by car on the Chapman's Peak drive, a fantastic road with magic views towards the bay and the mountains. And of course you should continue to the Cape Point.

A short stop. We were on he Blue bus tour and stopped here for lunch. Not a lot going on but we had fish and chips at the wharf which was pretty good and then watched a local feeding seals. The beach looked good.

Relaxing fishing village with seals😊. Had a drive through Cape Town of with an amazing time spent in Hout Bay , the crew out to the seal island was a high point if the day and gave a wonderful sea view of Chapman Peak

next time I'll bring my kids and we'll be surfing. Check it out if you like your beach activities. Water is frisk, but cristal clear. Waves clöosed out fair "one-move" and mushy from the top, so cleared for even youger kids. Mom can enjoy her sip of Sauvignon in "The Dunes" cafe while keeping hubby and offspring under obeservation.

Gorgeous views. During the day the shout Bay has gorgeous colors and a super nice beach - the latter a bit windy though. The the Dunes restaurant is a nice way to end a walk at the beach ... Late afternoon the bay gets a bit shadowy as the sun us behind the Chapmans Peak mountains

Restaurant Dunes. Good atmosphere and variety of nice sea food,. A nice place to bring kids as there is a man made beach where kids can enjoy and have dinner. Quite safe though supervision is necessary.

Must taste the seafood. Hout Bay is one of the best of the best places to take your seafood lunch/dinner
it is really very fresh and delicious, you can't miss
REALLY BEAUTIFUL ON A SUNNY DAY. We visited Mariners Warf at Hout Bay, this was rather disappointing. The restaurant there was pretty bad, but the bay made up in terms of beauty.

Beautiful & serene yet close to the action of Cape Town. Virtually anywhere you go in Hout Bay you see stunning views of mountains & even ocean in the distance. The wine farms of Constantia begin only 10 minutes away, the stunning nature of Llandudno beach is 15 minutes away, the beaches action of Camps Bay 20 minutes away. We prefer the low traffic & great restaurants & grocery stores of HB as a base. The action is never far away.
Beautiful scenery and quaint. Real old style fishing village and a place where you can get up close to the seals. A visit to seal island is a must

A months visit to SA including a visit to Nysna and a sunset cruise out of the WaterfrontCape Town, 2 of the highlights. Local knowledge is a great help, Clive organises well and very easy company, Table Mountain has to be a must the views are amazing
The place for seafood. Seafood at the harbour is a must. Stunning views. Nice beach. Gift shops and live music also available.

Beautiful scenery, amazing people and seals. Visit Hout Bay for scenery, touristy shopping and fun people. Ferry to the seal island not necessary as there are a couple of guys feeding a seal on the quay. Seals can't jump, right?

Fantastic views of fantastic landscapes. As a Mediterranean, I was astonished by those long and wide, vast white beaches, with tall sand dunes, wild waves, and weeds coming out of the water. Great. Take the boat to visit the islets with the seals. It only takes 40 minutes, it is cheap (35R) and you will get as close to a crowd of seals as ever.

A pleasant, lively town. Hout Bay is situated between Camps Bay and Chapman's Peak drive. It is a lively town with restaurants and on certain days, two markets, one outdoor, and one indoor. We explored the indoor market, which is at the western end of town, and sampled some lovely waffles at a stall there. (The choice of food is fantastic).Boat trips are run from the harbour, to see the seals, and view the many wrecks around the coast.An unusual occurrence just before we arrived, a Cape Cobra found its way onto the beach, and was watched for about an hour by the locals.

Very Relaxing. We spent a lovely week in Hout Bay. We wanted something close to Cape Town but somewhere with a beach and a laid back feel. We were so pleased we found Hout Bay. It's a 20 minute drive to the centre of Cape Town and the scenery is just spectacular along the coast and we never tired of the trip even though we went into the city on most days.Hout Bay is packed with restaurants, great shops and a beach. What more could you ask. Just stunning and then easy access up to Chapman's Peak and over the mountain into another spectacular area of SA. We had a fantastic time and we were really sorry to leave.

Go to Snoekies and order fish and chips!. Love Hout Bay, and Snoekies of Hout Bay has the best fish and chips in the world, we ordered 2 kids meals and 2 adults meals and I think we could have easily fed 20 people! Loved every second of it

Amazing coast. A small fishing port set in great area. The sea and mountain are wonderful and a place everyone should visit if possible. Local people very friendly and lots of African stalls with souvenirs to suit everyone.

Sunday market is worth a visit. We only went to Hout Bay for the market which was amazing with lots of handmade goods to buy and interesting snacks and coffee.Hout Bay itself was disappointing but to be fair we didn't see the beach .What we did see was quite dirty and there were several residents of the Shanty Town rummaging in bins which was sad to see.
Hout Bay. Relaxing to walk around. You have to experience the food at Snoekies Awesome!Shops are nice and the curious are always interesting. Lots of boat trips or see the locals feed the robs.

Go to Seal island. Hout Bay as such is a harbour village like many others close to Cape Town. If you are interested in wildlife however take a boat trip to Seal Island. It does not take long, but is worth the time and money. There are several tour operators and you may even snorkel among the seals.

A lot to do and to see!. We spent a week end at the Flora Bay Resort at the start of Chapman`s peak. We had good meals in the Outlook restaurant and the Fisherman`s Wharf. You can go on a boat trip. We visited the food and miscellaneous market in the old harbour.
WOW amazing drive. WOW WOW WOW truly beautiful drive from Boulders Bay to Camps Bay. So many places to stop and take pictures. Highly recommend to hire a car and drive around the coast.

Nauticat Charters - Boat Trip into Hout Bay. The Nauticat is one of the number of charter boats that take one on a short trip into the bay and onwards to Seal Island.The trip takes about 40 mins and offers spectacular views of the surrounding mountains, as well as the seals at Seal Island. This can be classed as a minor sea trip so do not feel concerned about sea sickness. The boat travels quite slowly so there is minimal pitching and tossing.Take a warm top just in case, put on sun cream, take the camera and enjoy the trip ! Take the left hand side of the boat as this is on the side of Seal Island - where the boat stops for 10 minutes or so.Costs (23 Feb 2016) was ZAR 85 for an adult. Other boats charge less(or more) but I found this good value and there was ample space for sitting or standing. Sit outside for a bracing experience.Turn up early and you will be treated to the locals feeding seals. Also take a walk around the harbour, buy some fish and try one of the restaurants.Even though I am a Cape Townian, I thoroughly enjoyed the trip !
Great for a quick visit. Perfect spot to see Sea Lions, and have a change to buy many different African trinkets. The beach and sea are simply stunning.
A LIVELY FISHING HARBOUR. Interesting and ver lively fishiong harbour with fast food restaurant serving fresh fish. Nice beach also and a lovely setting

Interesting harbour.. It was initialy just a stop to go to Cape of Good Home. But it has revealed quite interesting with boats, sun, people and seals... It was reaaly nice to have lots of photos giving colour and detail at such a beatiful place.

Great little bay and town. Stopped here for a couple of hours and had a wonderful walk around the bay and then stopped for lunch and watched the world go past. Nice little harbour area with lots of fishing activities going on. Use the get on, get off Cape town tour bus which makes Houts Bay very convenient to get to.
Entertaining penguin boat excursion. Visited Hout Bay as part of a day trip and the boat ride to Duiker Island was a worthwhile optional extra.

Republic Of Hout Bay. Leisurely sunday drive. Pop into Mariners wharf and smell the fish and seafood on offer. Stroll along the wharf and snack on a ice cold snow cone. Watch the seagulls swooping in to catch a morsel or scrap left out.

Quaint fishing harbour. This is a nice stop-over on the way or from Cape Point. The harbour with its fishing boats is worth a visit. There is also a fish market and a nice seafood restaurant. The bay with a view to Chapmans Peak is also lovely.

Not to be missed. We were on a 3 day tour when we stopped in Hout Bay. The harbour is a very busy place, with loads of market stalls to buy gifts to bring home. It was amazing to see a seal jumping out of the water to take fish out of a mans mouth!
Fabulous views. We drove from Boulders Beach across Chapmans Peak and the views of Hout Bay are amazing! Well worth visiting if you are in the area.

Mariner experience. The wharf is a working fishing yard with a lot of attractions. The shop selling sea shells have an amazing selection of familiar & unusual shells. The Mariners Restaurant has an authentic feel & our breakfast of toasted sandwiches & tea was delicious. Limited veggie options unfortunately so lunch out of question for vegetarians. The shop selling maritime memorabilia had a very interesting and antique collection of goods. On opposite side of bay the restaurants are more varied and you could take a lovely walk along the beach. Overall a very pleasant day out.
South of Cape town and worth a visit.. This is a lovely fishing port with some great markets and restaurants around. A walk along the working pier is definitely worthwhile.

Beautiful scenery, Great for a Wander, Local Wildlife Seals the Deal!. Came here by Hop On Hop Off bus and decided to hop off and wander...attracted by the beautiful bay, the old and newer fishing boats, the amazing colours of the sea and the changing faces of the clouded mountains ringing the area.Didn't expect to run across a local fisherman who has clearly made friends with some of the local seal population ... and that they would stage an impromptu show. Will probably always tell the story of being advised (Loudly and with some indignation) by one said seal to get out of the way...as I was standing between him and his treat-dishing friend. My husband is just sorry he didn't have the camera on to record the scene!We didn't eat here but the fish and chips smelled good, there were locals buying fresh fish and an interesting menu. Definitely enjoyed the visit.
Impossible not to be impressed. At every turn on this coastline another amazing vista appears. This is well worth a drive around and stop off to take in the wonderful scenery.Watty
Love a trip here. Sea and beach were clean, we always love it here even when overcast. The views are stunning! Not very crowded , good photo opportunities.

Scenic!. The Hout Bay area is very scenic and I love to just drive around the area. The beaches are very nice too, but might get windy... There are definitely tourists around but not like in camps bay for example.

Gorgeous views!. This is a beautiful scenery bay to drive by. Absolutely gorgeous views of blue waters, white sand beaches, mountains, and more! We use the Blue route of the red tour buses City Sightseeings that goes through this bay.

Stunning Harbour. Hout Bay is a slightly hidden little harbour with great food and a tranquil atmosphere. There are one or 2 local guys who feed the seals and have named them too. They ask for a small donation to keep themselves as well as the local entertainment going.If you just want to spend a couple of hours relaxing, this is ideal.

Fishing boats in the harbour, seals, nice people, long beach. There was this old guy in the harbour that had got one of the seals to sit and take food from his mouth. He called her Angel. She was sweet, but then who wouldn't be when you get nice fishy food all the time? ;)

Beautiful bay, went seal snorkeling there. And also to the Friday night market (5-9), really niceThe snorkeling with seals takes place in Hout Bay (30 minutes drive from CT), it was amazing. On the way we saw a whale and a sun fish.Also there is a pass that has amazing views of the ocean.

A vist in Hout Bay. On the half way to the Cape of Good Hope at the beginning of the Chapmans Peak Drive, Hout Bay is a nice place for a break.
In the evening we recommend a visit at "Massimo's Restaurant" (Main Rd., Oakhurst Farm Park, Hout Bay 7806) with the best Pizzas in the Cape Region.
spectacular view. stunning view if you travel from camps bay to the cape of good hope, make sure you quickly stop before travelling on via chapmans.
Hout Bay Harbour. Most amazing shed market. A huge variety of foods, cloths and gift ideas for all. Only negative is the lack of parking in the area of the Shed Market.

Scenic, eclectic, fun to visit!. Hout's Bay can easily be reached by taking the Hop )n- Hop Off bus out of Cape Town.. it's a scenic and informative trip.. well worth the time and money...! Hout's Bay itself is oddly charming, with weathered buildings and picturesque seafood restaurants and bars.. all perched on the edge of the bay...even swimming in the bay is available...a very relaxed beach spot...
Great day in Hout Bay . We love the Harbour and rustic restaurant and African markets.Authentic fish shops and tons of fishing boats selling snoek.
Breathtaking. Enjoyed it tremendously. One of the highlights of our visit. Highly recommend it if you visit this area and have time.
Beautiful. Beautiful bay and a great place to see the hinders of seals and their pups. We did this as part of a day tour and it is certainly worth a visit. Great restaurants and fabulous views
beautiful spot. We drove to Hout Bay easily from Cape Town. Had a trip on the ferry to grey seal island..... really not a lot to see...but if you have time worth a visit.
Interesting area. Lovely bay surrounded by spectacular mountain ranges. Good artisan market on Saturdays. Seals basking in bay. Drive over Chapman's Peak worth doing. Variety of restaurants and bars
Beautiful part of the world. Little bit windy the day we visited, however view was stunning and the fish and lobster at snoekies was great

The Republic of Hout Bay. Sad to see that Authorities have done little to stop the informal settlement from growing. Despite that however, Hout Bay is a little gem that's great housing, great shops, restaurants and an amazing market in the harbour from Friday afternoon till Sunday. This is a great alternative for those who do not want to go to Woodstock's Old Biscuit Mill market. Hout Bay's market offers great food, music, atmosphere, clothes, jewellery and crafts made by communities and young entrepreneurs. Come and support the locals!! Out Bay is at the start of chapman's Peak - a scenic drive that winds up and down taking you to Noordhoek, Kommetjie, Kalk Bay, Boulders (the penguin beach) and other equally amazing must see sights like the Cape Point/Cape of Good Hope which is the most south-westerly tip of the continent.
Beautiful. Lovely place to play on the beach but even better to eat lunch or dinner over looking the bay. Loved ot

Glad we stopped here.. We were on the red bus and it stopped here ..looked so good we decided to stay. And what a treat of a place. Beautiful beach area and lovely petite working port. Oh and the Yacht club restaurant served amazing Hake and Chips. Our table was right overlooking the water and and had a display from the seals frolicking about.
Views from the highway. We had rented a car and were traveling from Cape Town around the tip of Africa. The views of the ocean are great and the landscape is different in all ways.
Beautiful place to walk, and enjoy the day. Don't miss going here, windy, but really awesome for taking lots of photos, and enjoy the whole day.
Excellent. Was on a day tour of the Cape peninsula. Took the option of the seal tour while there. Would certainly recommend. Short boat ride with amazing scenery.
Nature at its Best. Hout Bay is amazing - truly one of the best places to stay. The beach, seals, ocean, Chapmans Peak leave one speechless. Were fortunate to see dolphins also today
my favorite beach on the peninsula. really breathtaking, and so empty; i took so many pictures, i couldn't have enough of it; I really want to come back

Nice place. Hi. Good place to stop over. Nice beach but cold water :-) Good restaurants. Need to go along the jetty and inside the docks where there are some nice street vendors whose prices are better than Greenmarket place.

So much fun!. Hout Bay was great! The seals are adorable and the coffee shop is amazing! We went during the off season and unfortunately couldn't do a ton with the seals but there was a guy feeding them for tips. Offer him an extra bucks and he'll let you do it!

lovely setting. A nice place to walk along the beach, it is very quiet. Nice harbour, lots of vendors on the street but i was told that the prices are set for tourists, bargain hard if there is anything tht you see.

A must see. Hout Bay is in a beautiful setting and has so much to offer. There are a number of restaurants to choose from around the bay. Take a walk along the beach, or just relax on it. Great fish & chips near the boats. Watch the fishermen's catches of the day, and buy these fresh off the boat. There is more to Hout Bay than the bay itself. Take a drive up to the local township or head to Chapman's Peak. There is The Bay market over the weekends where a selection of international foods, beers and crafts are sold. If you don't have a car, use the hop on hop off bus which stops just outside Mariner's Wharf.
Fantastic little bay . Very cute little area with fantastic freshly made fish and chips place! Lovely beach too. There are some little street traders selling gifts but you need to bargain ...

Great Cycling. I cycled from Cape Town most mornings.Going along the coast road its about 13 miles with a nice climb. Going through this cute topwn of Hout bay and continuing up Chapmans peak. Lots of place to have coffee and drinks and even a great bike shop .

What an experience!. This is a must do and see for everyone - locals and visitors! The food is brilliant at The Mariner's Wharf and the local people give a special vibe to the experience. We were there during 'rush hour' but all went so smooth! Just love the rugged feeling of eating outdoors!  The town is quaint - worth a while to stroll through it!

Quiet Place,Seal island cruise. I had lunch with freshly prepared fish and chips at Mariner's Wharf.The view is beautiful from the restaurant.We went for the Seal island cruise which was an experience in itself-both the ride to the island and getting to see the seals from such close quarters.
Working Harbour with great vibe. A lovely drive to get to Hout Bay Lots of restaurants. Beach good for lovely walks. Quaint little shops. Holiday vibe all year round

Great local beach area a lot like Monterey Bay Ca. Take the Hop On Hop Off to get here. Really pretty local beach area. Great sand beaches, crystal clear waters abound. Local marinas, pier restaurants. Just off the beach area are local horse stables and riding trails.

Breathtaking. This was my favourite part of my trip to cape town.Just a few miles out of town it really is a place to visit,full of character and breathtaking scenery.There were fur seals in the harbour and it was just a great place to chill out for a few hours

This is the Place to go. Take the ou Kaapse weg to Hout Bay, stroll at the beatyfull Beach, go further ab north Direction Capetown, have a Sundowner at the 12 Apostels...thats a perfect Day for this Wonderfull Area!
Red Bus Stop not to be missed. Fishermans Wharf Restaurant and Seal Island are not to be missed.They are both excellent. Tip: Reserve a table before you go on the boat.

Stunning. This is the bay where you leave for the tour of seal island. There are boats leaving every 30 mins and it's about a 40 min round trip. The view from the other side of the bay leaves you breathless

Nice bay. Hout Bay is situated approximately a 30 min. drive from central Cape Town. Beautiful bay with an interesting commercial harbor, several shops and restaurants. The Woodward shop in Hout Bay (not far from the bay itself) is exceptionally nice.

much better than camps bay, less touristy. more chilled, really not a fan of camps bay, if you want to strut around in heels in south africa...why? houts bay a zillion times better. check out seal island, have oyster bloody mary shots and relax!

Part fishing port part tourist venue. The bay is lovely but was very windy when we were here. There is a working harbour so excellent fish and sea food but not sure about swimming. Pleasant for a short stop on the red bus but not enough to engage for more than a couple of hours
Interesting but not exciting. We stopped here briefly en route to Cape Point. From what little I saw, it seemed to consist mainly of a marina and some souvenir stalls.
best fish in south africa. anice stop on hop on hop off blue bus tour great fish and chips well served ouick service freshly cooked also good boat trip to seal island good indoor market

Lovely for a relaxing day out.. Beautiful drive out to Hout Bay and once you there it's a very laid back and tranquil place.The beaches are nice and clean and also not crowded. Some very good restaurants there but be careful as some of them are pricey. You can hop on a boat o visit Seal Island which boats roughly 10 000 seals. If you lucky you might even see a great white shark.Well worth a visit on a sunny day.

Just some tourist shops. My friend had been encouraged to go because of the "market"; I happened to stop by first so was able to report that it was a couple of cafes, som generic tourist shop items. The active fishing boats are good to see, but that's it

More than meets the eye. Most of the year this is a quiet place to stop but it is busy on public holidays. Visit the seals on seal island by boat. Have an excellent fish meal upstairs in the huge restaurant upstairs in the main oldy worldy complex.Drive out to nearby chapman's peak for specular views.

Walk on the beach. In spite of a gale-force southeasterly wind, we had a very pleasant walk on this beach while paddling in the shallows of the ocean. Spectacular views of the bay and surrounding mountains.
sightseeing. we had a good boat trip to seal island , weather was good and also going around the bay and to watch the sights of mountains

Family friendly sea side fun. Great day out with the family. We visited the beach and a restaurant called Dunes right on the beach too. Lots of little boutiques and coffee shops to wander around in town. Beautiful drive along the twelve apostles and a good stop off before Chapmans Peak!

Serendipity - perfect day visit or long stay. Hout Bay is a perfect destination with bits and lots of everything. From forest, mountain and sea views to lovely beaches and horse riding. It is about 20km from Cape Town - its is a beautiful scenic drive from Camps Bay side. Lovelly restaurants and shops. Visit the Bay Harbour Market for delicious food and locally hand made products. Another great place for Fish and Chips is Fish on the Rocks - this is in the proximity of the Bay Harbour Market. There is public transport - the MyCiti Bus will take you into the Harbour Market. Hout Bay town has a number of lovely restaurants from Pubs, Italian, to Sushi. There are boats that will take you out to Seal Island. You can take a drive up to Chapman's Peak for amazing views of Hout Bay and the surrounds.

wonderful family visit. we visited this area with the family, kids and adults. there is something for everyone. the pristine beach and the icy waters, the boats in the harbour, make for postcard viewing. there are many restaurants to choose from. there is also a bird and money park in the area

Wonderful Beach. We visited Hout Bay during a circular drive of the Cape Peninsula. The pristine beach and blue sea were captivating. The working fishing harbour held our interest and only time persuaded us to leave the sights and smells. Mariner's Wharf was fascinating.

entertaining. Spent a couple of lunch times here just watching the tuna fishing boats come in and the locals enjoying the festive period. Very busy on New Years day which was very entertaining. Nice seafood restaurant and good white wine at the harbour front.
A must visit when in CT. To visit Hout Bay when in CT is compulsory, very peaceful and serene with the original charm of Fishing Village and how it has grown into a commercial fishing & seafood hub.
Beach lovers. Great for family relaxation. Scenic, clean, white sand accessible.Half hour drive from Cape Town center.

Awesome with spectacular views!. Hout Bay is an awesome place. Here you can enjoy a good traditional fish & chips meal at the famous Mariners Wharf Restaurant, located in Hout Bay Harbor. You can also take a boat ride from here to seal island. The views from Chapmans Peak is out of this world.

One of my favourite places in Cape Town. I always tell friends and visitors here alike to visit Hout Bay. They have a relatively new and cool Hout Bay Harbour Market, next door to arguably the best place to eat fish and chips in Cape Town (Fish on the Rocks).If you want to visit Seal Island nearby, take the Drumbeat charter boat, it's a great experience! (be warned that the boat ride can be rocky.. which is part of the fun, and the island itself WILL be smelly). Note you can't get off the boat onto the island.. it's just a huge group of seals living together on a huge rock, and the boat drives around it and stops for a while.You can also buy fish here direct from the fisheries for quite cheap, but be careful of buying their previously-frozen fish, and also buying during peak tourist season.. it's advisable to know what the going rate is before you buy.There's also a Naartjie Kids clothing factory store (above the Spar grocery shop / opposite the Engen garage) that have amazing sales occasionally (go as soon as the sale starts, else you wont find anything worth buying). To the left of the Spar, where the bar is, you'll also find a Bug Zoo kids clothing shop (not as nice as Naartjie), and a pretty decent clothing shop for grown-ups opposite it.There are 3 roads into Hout Bay.. one tolled road via. Chapmans Peak (most amazing drive ever), one from Kirstenbosch gardens, and one from Camps Bay beach. Chapmans Peak is sometimes closed when the weather is bad, for safety reasons.. try and google the road status before you go, but it's normally open on great sunny days (obviously the best time to view any panoramic nature)To maximise your views and photo ops, I highly recommend getting there from Camps Bay, and going back to Cape Town via. Chapmans Peak and Silvermine Nature Reserve (it's a longer route, but so worth the views). Also, Silvermine is one of the top attractions in Cape Town.. Chapmans peak also has a lot of picnic spots that are certainly worth stopping for! You won't regret it

evening meal at the harbour. Visited Hout bay Mariners Wharf restaurant in the evening, our waitress was very pleasant, food was ok, what we wanted was to walk along the harbour and sea front, but were advised not to do so as it was not safe at night.

Nothing extra ordinary. Considering there are so many lovely beaches and coast line in South Africa, found this fishing village average. It's one of the stop of hop on bus, but really not much to do here
beautiful. Part of our Cape Peninsula Tour. Beautiful and we drove past but did not stop. Wish we had more time to stop and walk around.

Lovey day eating fish which i hate!. spent the day driving around with my dad and we stopped for lunch on the pier where they sold us huge baskets of fish & chips (him) and calamari & chips (me - i don't eat fish). What a joy!Plain, even rough surroundings, the sea right there, and the knowledge that this community is not gonna judge you if they overhear you saying something that does not fit into their relaxed lifestyle. Just "cool it,dude" kindna thing? Effective anyway.Love the spot!!!!!

Lovely Fishing Bay. It's a must if in the Cape Town area. Lovely fishing town at the bottom of Chapmans Peak tourist drive. Boat trips are available to seal island. The trip there is not for the faint hearted as the sea can be fairly gruesome at times. Don't have a skinful before the boat trip!!Having said that, you WILL see lots of seals.

Worth a visit.. We passed by this location on our way to Slangkop via the Toll road. A lovely location at any time for chilling or taking a beach experience. The higher the view, the better the whole bay looked. There is a number of view points on the coastal route which winds its way ever upwards until the bay is displayed from an optimum location just before the road leads inland. To see the bay from lower down the Toll road, day passes can be obtained from the booth.

Useful but harbourside could be prettier. Harbourside mainly looks like a fishing port, this is nonetheless worth stopping at, to eat some local seafood or catching a cruiser to Duiker Island aka seal island (views of the bay are better from the boat). Seals also come up to the harbourside too. We wanted to visit Fish on the Rocks but this was too far away from the City Sightseeing stop.

Great Place to visit, namely on weekends with food market and genuine souvenir shops.. Must check-out on weekends. Great food places and interesting for shopping of some souvenirs. In the little village and if you are a beads fan, don't miss the "RockBead" shop. For a snack, check the Dunes restaurant out which is perfectly located at the seadside.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful places in and around Cape Town and definitely worth a visit for the famous fish and chips. Lovely markets.

Lovely Day Trip. Mariners wharf is a must for fish and chips. ...nice market at far end...good beaches...and sightseeing of seal island ..The queue is really really long during peak season it's better to eat upstairs in the restaurant a bit pricy but less congested...I have eaten the most magical garlic butter sauce with my fish dish..was so creamy and fluffy. ...divine! Fresh seafood and good service.
If it wasn't for the food..... The only reason we drive to HoutBay is to enjoy the delicious fish and chips at the harbour. The area however is dirty and smells very bad. We did not stay long.

Quaint fishing village. Whether going for a walk along the harbor, getting an excellent plate of fish and chips, ice cream from the amazing little Gelateria or a dip at the beach, Hout Bay has something for everyone. There is also a craft market on the weekends. Lovely stop on the way to Chapman's Peak.

good base for the cape. we have stayed in hout bay several times. It is a nice suburban seaside resort with many good shops and restaurants but we choose mostly for the position. From there , there are 4 main routes out, all of them delightful to drive, Atlantic coast route to the city, Chapman's Peak or M3 to the peninsula and route via Kirsten bosch, Rhodes Drive to the city. Highly recommend for independant travellers with a car who want to access best places in the Cape

Scenic Day Tour. Hout Bay is as typical as any other fishing bay/village in the world. 20 minutes from CBD.Most famous for its fish & chips, world of birds sanctuary, arts & crafts market , boat trips to Seal Island & shipwrick & not to mention the most eco friendly beaches and surrounds. But what makes it different is the most picturous views coming into and going out the bay. Mounted between Chapmans Peak and Sentinel Hill. The bay and beaches are best viewed from Chapmans Peak side. Easily accessible from CBD and Constantia side of the Cape Peninsula via car & bus. Toll fees applies for car & bus access to Chapmans Peak only. Alternatively access views from the Mosque on the Hill & mingle with locals. Take a walk on the jetty & see some locals managing "un-trained" seals or buy some fresh fish caught in resident coastal waters from local fisherman. A highly reccommended item for tasting some of the best fish the Cape has to offer. Best visited during hot summer months using the sight seeing hop on hop off bus sight seeing tour bus from the V & A Waterfront.
Gorgeous!. More gorgeous cape scenery. Stop often along the drive to take pics and soak it all in. Don't miss World of Birds while in Hout Bay.

Cute place for a short stop and some food. At Hout Bay, there is a small beach, a handful of shops- minerals, nautical antiques, crafts made from pearls, etc., as well as several places to eat seafood. In addition, you can catch a boat to Duiker island where you circle the island in a boat to view the fur seals.Lovely spot

Lovely ocean breeze . A good place to get really tasty fish and chips, and other seafood. Restaurants at the wharf as well as Fish On The Rocks are tasty and affordable. Offers lovely views of the bay and Chapman's Peak. The ocean breeze is lovely.
Wonderful. Stayed with friends who live in Hout Bay and really enjoyed it! Small town atmosphere, real holiday town vibe. Beautiful area. Worth a visit! Stay here if you can!
Visit from Canada. Lovely location and the best calamari I have ever had at the Chapman's hotel. A great day drive from Capetown.

Mariners Warf. We visited Hout Bay after a dip in Camp's Bay's lovely beach. Mariners Warf is a must if you are looking for awesome seafood. Battered Hake and Chips simply to die for. Also say hello to the daily visitor, the seal, he swims in the water just behind the restaurant.

Busy and vibrant harbor town. Expect lots of people (can be a bit frustrating) but worth a visit. Eat fresh fish (a variety of restaurant or take away places), watch the seals in the Barbour or the fishing boats. A busy beach too.
Picturesque ,plenty to see and do.. Loads of market stalls ,pretty bay area and a snorkel with the seals trip which we went on which was great .Watersports galore.

Beautiful Views of the Bay. The day we visited Hout Bay there was very strong smell of fish near the harbour. I am not sure if this is normal. A top for winwe tasting just before reaching Hout Bay was good experience. Tnhey charge you R15 per glass for tasting. This amount is taken off the bill if you buy bottles of wine.The visit to the location was very interesting and the people did not object to our presence. Once we traveled towards the Chapman's Peak, the view of the bay from the picnic is site was stunning. I always take my visiting friends and family for a drive up the Chapman's Peak road. From here you can go to Simons Town to see the Penguins or down to the Cape of Good Hope.
Another must see and do. Experience cpt culture at its best. Fish and chips at the harbour. A boat trip to seal island... awesome

SADLY SO LITTERED. On our red bus tour we passed through Hout Bay. It was so sad, what could be a lovely place, it was terribly littered and tatty. Get the community to clean it up with a litter driver. Let's keep Cape town clean.
I love Hout Bay. Hout Bay had its own unique vibe. If you are more into posh vacation, probably not your type of place. Life in Hoyt bay is more down to earth, barefoot and community style.

Beautiful views, especially on a beautiful day!. We watched the seals playing around the fishing boats, before going to lunch at one of the retaurants. Fantastic vibe, and afterwards we walked through the shops, buying items from different vendors. Lovely outing!

Hout Bay Food Market - well worth a visit.. At Hout Bay Food Market found amazing chefs from Vagabond Kitchens producing quality food (Beef or Tuna wraps or with salad) all at an affordable price of about R50.00 (fifty Rand) per wrap or plate of food. Worth a visit to see these young chefs at work producing excellent food.

Beautiful. We make a visit there using city hop-on-and-off-bus route. Breathtaking views at this beautiful place. We didn't pay attention that was Saturday,i.e.weekend and a nice sunny day,so to reach there we suffer a traffic and the place was crowded.

Beautiful spot on the coast with beaches.. This spot is very near Cape Town. It has spectacular views of the ocean and mountains near Cape Town. This is a must see if you are in Cape Town. Take a camera with a wide angle. Some of my best pictures while in Cape Town were taken here. It also has a large beautiful sandy beach and swimming area weather permitting.

Disappointing. There are so many wonderful places to visit in and around Cape Town, but Hout Bay is possibly the worst. The surrounding mountains and white sand are lovely but the port and car parks and ugly compared to the very pretty places such as Llandudno, Kalk bay, Camps bay etc. Really disappointing place and also has some lousy food there too - much nicer spots along the coast than this!

swimming with seals. Hout Bay is a place not to be missed. One can swim with seals or do snorkelling. Boat activities are really great. Fish and chips excellent. There is also a market where one can buy small gifts and African art

Nice for an outing . A trip to Hout Bay is a good one to have on any Cape Town agenda. Decent beach, fun harbour, boat rides, nice places to eat - a good combination of activities and shopping options that feels a little less hectic than other parts of CT.

Great location to stay. Staying in Hout Bay gives access to the Garden Route, and areas south of Cape Town, such as Cape of Good Hope, Simons Town and the Cape Peninsula. There is a working sea port, which is charming and a good range of restaurants.

Miss Green. Not the best time of the year to go, but the place was great! Beach is beautiful very relaxing environment, on the harbour you can find an awesome gift shop which sells really cool collectibles. However very pricey, but if you don't mind wasting cash you will find a lot of cool stuff there!

Excellent Place For Seafood Dinner and Viewing seals. There is a lovely small beach and fishing trawlers that are nice to look at at the dock. You can also see seals that come in for the fishermen´s scraps. A sleepy place but nice to get away from the hustle and bustel of Cape Town.

Wonderful town. Starting Point for Penquins. One expected at some point to be tired of the view but in reality it is still beautiful. This is a little Bay Area surrounded b the mountains - near the bay there are all thee yachts just resting. There are seafood restaurants etc and Pelicans flying close to the boats & seals swimming in the bay. While we were there, there was this busker Who would hold the fish in his mouth and kiss the seals. There is also a beach nearby.

Hout Bay visit.. Still a family favourite since childhood days. Maybe slightly commercialized nowadays but the fishing town experience, great restaurants and beautiful views are still a huge favourite!

Gorgeous View from further away. There are two or three viewpoints right after Hout Bay on the way the the Cape of Good Hope. It's definitely worthwhile to stop there and look back at the bay - outstanding!

Beach to bask on. I found the beach absolutely magnificent , and after a couple of hours in the sun I found a truly lovely little ice cream parlour and although conscious of dieting unfortunately one was not quiet enough

Relaxing stays with beautiful views. Personally I would not recommend Hout Bay for swimmers, but if you just want to relax and enjoy some beautiful scenery, this is the place! I stayed in Flora Bay Resort which has spectacular views over the bay. The restaurants are all really good and you can just unwind. I would also recommend the Red Bus tours.

Definitely one of the most beautiful places in the World . This place is most definitely in another world.
It is unfair that one place can have so much beauty situated in one Republic.
Awesome Awesome Awesome place.
Must visit.

Beautiful! Even worth it to just pass with a car!. Hout Bay is a beautiful town and harbour. If you don't have a lot of time, it is even worth it to just pass it with a car on your way to Chapman's Peak. But if you have time, buy an ice cream and sit on the beach, or have seafood at the Mariner's Warf. Our favourite fish and chips place in Hout Bay is definitely Snoekies. It may look a bit dodgy, but they have the best and freshest fish I've had before! Eat your fish and chips on the pier close to the restaurant, and watch the seagulls going crazy when you feed them!
Stunning!. This is a must see for people going to Cape Town for the first time! We truly enjoyed and will recommend everyone to go there at least once!

Hout Bay setting is lovely. The little town has a lovely setting and the main attraction is the Harbour. There are many restaurants, a gift shop and it is well worth taking a walk in the harbour. The beach is popular and clean
Fish and Chips with beautiful views. Awesome views and delicious fish & chips definately makes the trip worth while. A must see on a triip to Cape town.

Faboulous area. We took the boat to visit the the monk seals. The journey is 45 minutes in total. The sea was wavy . The monk seals are at least 2000 on the island and on the sea. İt was amazing to watch them jumping and trying to teach swimming to their babıes.

Charming town for a sunny day excursion. View of the bay from Chapmans Peak was fabulous. Great place to stop for some quite excellent fresh fish and chips.If time is available, hop on the Seal Island tour. A short 15 minute boat ride to the island where you get to see a good number of seals sunbathing on the rocks and frolicking in the water.

just get there , its a amazing place. gods country , the route along cpt coast from central cape town to magical hout bay (skip the corner mess) have a drink at pokololo then calamari next door , then thru chapmans peak , all the way , its will take your breath away , every time I am there holiday or business I have to have my fix , a drive thru chapmans peak ...breathless
A nice drive out from the city. Nice village atmosphere, carry on along Chapmans Peak Drive for excellent views and photo shoot, give the fish n chips a miss.
South African roadtrip . Really lovely place and the wharf and the harbour market are well worth a visit. Our only quipe we got there a tad late. The market is Friday to Sunday 10 till 4.

Don't miss the week-end market. This is a pleasant place to visit for a couple of hours. Go to the harbour and watch the fishing boats together with sea lions looking for a feed. There are usually market stalls on the quayside but you need to go to the very end of the road to find the indoor market which is open on Friday evening and all day Saturday and Sunday. Well worth a visit to find that unusual present to take home.
Best Fish & Chips Ever!. Had the most delicious calamari, prawns, king klip and chips whist at Hout Bay.... yummy! There's also a great little indoor market there too....

Mesmerizing scenic view!. This is the start of the coastline, exciting & yet peaceful! Along the coast there are nice restaurants, busy, there are beautiful houses as well. Seen this with the Hop On Hop Off Bus tour. Worth the trip!

Carry your passport :). Its called the "Republic of Hout Bay' The people are so posh that they have their own republic. Take your passport - alternatively, pick a hout bay citizenship in one of the souvenir shop (lol). Take a boat ride to see the seal. OR walk to the docs and you can see a few seals sitting and enjoying the sun (if you dont have time for boat ride)
Love this place. This small town has a very homey feeling to it with amazing views and the weekend market at the harbor is something you should go and visit.

Speed boat adventure in the bay. This is a ftastic experinece - although at the beginning I had a bit the impression that I am risking my life for nothing. Later it looked a bit less dangerous... The tour is great, the seals - hundreds - are cute, and the dolphins swimming with your speed boat..! it is simply unforgettable.Unfortunatley the beach where you embarke it is really dirty and un-managed.

Good for a couple of hours. Had lunch of fish and chips at the Mariners wharf, food very average but good view Took a 45 minute boat trip to the seals for 80 rand each. Watched the local fishermen unload their catch of tuna. Had a look round the African market (Friday's only) and got back into the car, this is just one of those trips you do when in the area as it looks better on the leaflets than in real life. wouldn't bother to do it again, b it good to stretch the legs if touring round!

Breathtaking view!. I especially enjoyed the trip to Hout Bay because the views are absolutely marvelous. Being a geology freak, the rock formations and topography of the area was magnificent. Don't forget to try out the famous fish+chips place!

In 1976,.... Republic of Hout Bay it was called.
It was nice and clean and there was a Swiss butcher that made stunning stuff.
Unfortunately it has come down a lot.
Sand all over, dirty and not well looked after. So pity!
Will it change?
Beautiful Hout Bay . Just love this place. Holds memories as grew up here but despite the population explosion it's still retains its unique charm.

Excellent boat charter to seal island and good fish and chips at Mariners wharf. There is freshly prepared fish and chips at Mariners Wharf. There are also very affordable charters to seal island around the corner from the resturant.

quaint town on the coast. This place is amazing. the small town vibe is wonderful. The Bay is very busy when the ships and boats come in with fresh fish or the catch of the day. The streets are safe and good for fitness enthusiast. Chapman's Peak is with in the borders of the town and always a pleasure to experience (fee of R24 for entry).

Go TouchDown tours took us here too!!. This was just another stop on our fabulous trip where I actually purchased a safari vest which I've always wanted and we took a ferry out to SEAL ISLAND which was AMAZING!!! Gorgeous mommy & daddy & even baby seals swimming and playing, eating! One of my highlights! Thanks Go TouchDown Tours!!
breathtaking wonderful on the way to the Kap. the trip from downtown here is a wonderful route with eyecatching views at every corner, at Hout Bay the view is breathtaking

Great View. I went to there on las week it's so beatiful ocean like carribean but here water it's cold even summer don't stay in Cape Town city center stay here or stay around this beatiful peninsula ,you will definetly love it and if you want travel South African don't your waste your time to stay Cape Town city center so you can stay those beatiful places simon's town ,Hout Bay,Nord Hoek Bay,Fish Hoek Bay,so there are so many place to stay in this beatiful peninsula not in Cape Town city center
Famous for Seals and scenery!. Another nice place at cape town.. It offers you to experience Seal at their natural habitat! Boat ride, scenic beauty and Seal trip, everything is just superb.

Fantastic views and very enjoyable drive!. This is a really enjoyable drive after camps bay with several great spots for photos, if time permits its definitely worth stopping to get that great shot even before you get to Hout Bay town itself. Went there when it was extremely windy so just drove around and admired the beauty. Did not get to stop off for Fish and chips but did this on a previous occasion and it was great sitting on the wharfside to enjoy the meal. With the extreme winds the beaches were deserted but still a beautiful sight. a bit further on is the chapmans peak drive from where great pics of the hour bay town and beach area can be taken!!
Very Beautiful. Cool place to visit on the water and near the mountains. So nice shopping and dining. Not far from Cape Town.

Excellent Place to see the seals. We drove here and easily found the harbour point for the seal trips. The trips run pretty frequently and you don't have to wait longer than 30 minutes. The price seemed to range from 65 to 80 RS each. Our boat, Drumbeat, had drinks and toilets available on board. The journey takes approx 40 minutes round trip and our boat wasn't overly crowded so plenty of space to take photos. The seals were great. I would recommend taking a windproof jacket as Hout Bay can get chilly due to the wind.We didn't, but you could get here by using the red hop on hop off bus company from Capetown.

Gorgeous views!. On the way to Cape Point, this is a must stop place if you're driving. It's an extremely scenic drive from Noordhoek to Hout Bay on Chapman's Peak Drive. Bring a camera and a packed lunch to enjoy the view from the picnic tables above.

beautiful area. The market is very good, the drive there is beautiful along the ocean. Once you are there it is worth the drive to go to Chapman Point, amazing drive. If you have a chance to tour the township there it is a real eye opener. This may not be for everyone but if you care about people this will move you, it gives makes you wish you could do more to help.

Staggering scenery in beautiful Hout Bay. The ride down past Noordhoek leads you to the beautiful beach and fishing village of Hout Bay. I loved the Bananas jewelry boutique where I bought my most loved treasures...a stunning necklace enrobed with abalone and beads made by the shops owner. There was also a beautiful bead shop a few steps away where I picked up some really nice strings of beads made from amethyst and other preious and semi precious stones. Be careful to make sure they include their VAT tax number on the receipt.I could have lingered and explored for hours in this lovely place. A sunny day here is perfection, especially if you choose the Chapman Peak toll road for more breathtaking scenery.

Good Day Out. We saw the seal colony just outside the bay, it was good to see them in their natural habitat. The smell is a little overwhelming but they are such comical characters and were quite inquisive.We were also lucky enough to see a Whale which is not on the agenda, it swam under the boat, quite scarey when you think how lare they are.

Great day in the bay!. We spent a lovely day in Hout Bay!Took a "glass bottom" boat to seal islandand returned to have lunch at Snoekies and after had desert at the great new market across the road from Snoekies.

Great restaurant there. There is a great seafood restaurant right by the bay and the views are magnificent. On the road to there there is a stretch that is often used in car commercials because of the vista with the winding road over the bay.
Market. The foodmarket in houtbay is great! It so much fun and a lot of stuff to buy! And the food is amazing!!Love it! And try the honey!!!!

Nice Area. Enjoyed this area. We went back twice. Once in the day time the views are wonderful and then in the evening for a market. Nice short drive outside the city and I got a real different sense of South Africa.

unforgettable moments. we get a sea cruise into the heavy waves to an island and we saw many seals there swimming and sleeping :Dtry to book early and stand in the front of the ship ..it costs around 60R or 70R per person for 40 minutes cruise
Great Beach. A great beach with lots of activities, if you are a fish lover there is lots of restaurants that specialize in fish dishes, also some fish markets around.
Wow. We visited hout bay on the hop on hop off bus. We went back the next day to appreciate the beauty. It is scenic
Scenic!. This is a relaxing scenic area but you can also see about horseback riding nearby. What a great spot to just lounge and at the same time, feel alive.
Great place for kayaking. You can paddle in the bay, and (on a sunny day, mostly in summer) watch the paragliders hovering down from the mountain overhead.

Bustling little place with a proper harbour and plenty of places to eat or drink. A good location both for the beach (although often windy here!) and lots of restaurants and cafes. Its also at the end of Chapman's Peak Drive so a good place to stop if you need refreshment.The harbour is a functioning fishing harbour so expect to see the catch arrive early in the morning and sea lions lurking around hoping for scraps.By the side of the harbour there are a number of craft stalls and cafes.

Very beautiful from the Chapman Peak drive. The Hout Bay looks very beautiful from the top of the road. Our experience is that it looks better from faraway than closer. We drove around a while to find a restaurant with a good view, but many areas did not look that nice. We ended up sitting at the Chapman Peak hotel restaurant which had a partial view of the bay.We were a bit disappointed, but we did not explore every inch of the place, so must have missed some nice places.
lovely when the weather is good. Visited twice and the first time the weather was lovely and it was lovely the second time the wind was blowing the the sand could cut the legs off you so be careful

The real experience is the Penguins. Go and enjoy the Penguins at Boulder Beach. So endearing along with other bird life and small creatures. The walkways keep you close for viewing, yet out of the sand. Loved it!

Gorgeous Gorgeous. Beautiful bay. Enjoy Fishermans Wharf Restaurant for excellent lobster-- or any meal. Even just for a glass of wine. The view is gorgeous and when low tide it is perfect for your kids and dogs
Great place to spend the day. Take the bus from Cape Town. There is a great working fishing port where you have a number of stores and good restaurant upstairs.

Soo nice . Got there with sightseeing tour, blue route.
After passing Imizamo Yethu, we went to Hout Bay. Beautiful ... !!
We were there on a cloudy day, but the area is great. You can take a beach walk on and "taste" the cold water eheheh !!
Lovely place i must say !

great markets. Went here at night and some of the best food i have had at the markets in Hout Bay. So full of life , colour and sound. Beware the gangs of street kids that hang around at night asking for money.
The only town with it's own passport. A good place to visit, with beach, lots of restaurants, touristy shops, a waterfront, world of birds, township tours, all within a really quaint town.

Awesome Hout Bay. A must do when you visit Cape Town! Situated at the foot of the EVER so beautiful Chapman's Peak, Hout Bay offers you a tranquil atmosphere with stunning little shops and top class restaurants. A must visit is Mariners Wharf, where you can enjoy the beautiful views of Hout Bay and enjoy stunning fish and chips at the rustic restaurant!!! Truly worth a visit....

Make sure you visit the market!. Unfortunately it was raining when we visited but there were still some seals out playing in the water which was entertaining. Make sure you visit the Hout Bay Market! Lots of delicious food stands (don't miss the fish & chips) and beautiful clothing/crafts for sale.

Best Fish and Chips, great spot. Go There and see this old fishing village now a tourist attraction but with fishing boats still there. Scenery wonderful. Seals all around. My third visit will not be my last

Beutiful. My friend took me around the peninsular and we came down over Chapmans peak overlooking Hout bay. Stunning scenery I can't get over. we went for fish'n'chips at snookies which was tasty and great value. The town itself is quaint and worth a walk around with its boutique shops and restaurants.

Relaxing and Peaceful. Hout Bay is well worth visiting during a trip to Cape Town and is only a short distance away. The township has a number of restaurants and cafes and there is plenty of choice. The bay offers calm waters and the scenery is beautiful. An unexpected find so close to Cape Town.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Try it at sunset. Just after the perilous but wonderful roadway hugging the coast , you reach Hout Bay. Great views at sunset and oppportunities for water sports. However most eateries are not that great. May need more exploring to get the right one.

Nice place for lunch. This place is pretty lovely for a short stop off. A village covered in sand. Locals are friendly. There is a great fish and chip shop serving good portions. You might even see a couple of seals if your lucky.

Fish and chips on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Hout Bay is glorious on a sunny day. There are craft markets and the harbour has many restaurants and quaint little boutiques to browse around in. However, for most Capetonians, Hout Bay is THE place for fish and chips on a wintery day. Scrumptious!

Nice place to visit and to live!. I used to live here so I know it rather well. The village has developed in size over the years and the facilities have grown in time too.it is still spectacularly beautiful, with many mountain walks, some good dive sites, a nearby seal colony.Lots of restaurants, some bars and a beach.Plenty of stuff to make a visit worthwhile.

Hop on Hop off stop at Hout Bay. There are a number of restaurants and shops at the waterfront. We also decided to take the boat to see the seals and view the pass. While this was a good trip, the weather changed after we got on the boat and it was pretty cold. Worth the trip.
Great Place. Love Hout Bay , so relaxing, great restaurants and fabulous views. the working harbour just adds to the fun.
A beautifull place. Went here on coach trip on the way to Cape of Good Hope and Simons town, and boulder beach. Very picturesque, nice walks etc

A homey little town. Hout Bay is a welcoming and inviting town like place to visit. The people are friendly enough and can be engaged with, without an accosting aura in the air. The weather fluctuates from very rainy to very sunny and everything is in close proximity to ea other. 12 Apostles is a breath away and there are many entries into this beautiful place. You can take the scenic drive from Town or the no nonsence drive from Constantia etc. The night life is awesome and the beach side is refreshing. For the traveller looking for home away from home this is the place to be. Welcome and enjoy

A beautiful large sandy bay with mountain backdrop.. a sheltered bay suitable for swimming ,not surfing.There is a small marina with fishing and pleasure boats.whilst we were there we were entertained by a local boy feeding by putting pieces of fish in his mouth and leaning over the harbour wall for the seals to reach the food. We did not eat there but the fish restaurant had a great menu.The local town had a number of classy shops and super markets.

Just delightful. A wonderful beach adjacent to the Hout Bay Hotel. Scenery splendid and spectacular, the beach is prestine and the Chapman's Peak route is not to be missed. Just another jewel in the Cape's crown.

Beautiful. Hout Bay is beautiful, and only 40 minutes south of Cape Town on the way to Cape Point. Bird World (or something like that) is there. It seems and is a bit touristy, but it is fun, even for a curmudgeon like I. We went there on a whim, and we were glad we did.

Great place for fish and chips. Hop on a boat and visit Seal Island if you can. The kids will love seeing the seals play in the surf and it is a great way to spend a sunny afternoon. Photos available on our tazzdiscovers instagram account.

A good place to reflect on life. The sea air, the blue mountains in the background, the blue sea and golden sand, what else would you like to make you sunny afternoon or evening perfect. A few good eateries are around as well as some places to just grab a drink, although you do not need money to enjoy this place. A nice spot to reflect a de very body is full of smiles here.

Trendy seaside village with good beaches and eateries. Good place to visit on week days. The beach offer a good place for a sunset stroll or walking the dogs. Many eateries off a wide variety of food at cafes that spill onto the pavements. Good way to spend time with friends while enjoying good food or a drink. Can be very busy and crowded over weekends, public holidays or the peak tourist season of December and January.

Welcome to the Republic of Hout Bay. Hout Bay makes probably the best fish and chips I'm Cape Town and probably one of the prettiest post cards too. The market is full of high quality food and entertainment and locally produced products (really above average). Don't forget a walk on the beach and the world of birds that is close by. Just be careful of the area close to the Harbour as you're eating your ice cream at sunset, a few dodgy pickpockets hang around sometimes
Beautiful Views. Hout Bay has beautiful views, and it was wonderful to watch the seals lazing around or swimming gracefully in the bay. The views are very inspirational.
Stunning View. We only had a quick stop but it was definitely worth it. We stopped at a view point just above the bay. Just beautiful!
Visiting The Seal Island. This is a very nice bay. There are boats to the seal island that you can see the seal together. There are some fish markets where you can eat fresh fish.
Lovely Bay. A lovely place visit, and can recommend Dunes Restaurant which is on the beach and has good views and nice food.

Quick stop on the way to Cape Point. It's a small fish village on the way south to Cape Point. Usual native souvenirs plus some shark related items. There are a number of seals to be seen swimming around the harbor. You can also take a seal boat tour from here. Warning. The seal boat your that we saw leaving was really packed!!

Very nice place to visit & get souvenirs. Get off the Red Open Top Bus here and wander about. There's a colourful fishing fleet, there are fat seals (don't forget to pay a tip if someone is keeping them out of the water for tourists to pose with), and there's a plethora of little gift stalls selling all sorts of souvenirs (make sure you bargain as some advertised prices are higher than in some V&A or hotel shops, but cheaper than at the airport). There's also a lovely long beach, and you can buy fish & chips to eat here. The bay is beautifully shaped, and you'll get stunning photos of it from Chapman's Peak Drive.
Pretty stop or destination. Another pretty stop on the way to Cape Hope or as a destination. Good fish and chips places there too.

Nice little fishing village. Hout Bay is a nice little fishing village just south of Cape Town on the Atlantic side of the Cape peninsula. It is well worth the brief jaunt down here to get away from the hustle and bustle of Cape Town. There is some excellent scenery on the way. The boat tour to Duiker Island to see the fur seals is good value for your money. It only cost about $7 US when I was there recently. There is also a nice market and some local performers at the docks.

Pretty fishing port. Pretty fishing port between Simon's Town and CPT. good shopping for a small community. Interesting walk around Mariners Wharf, places to eat and free parkinf so not pestered to look after your car
quaint little town. A wonderful place to visit, and very beautiful, is a fishing village and is Cape Towns best kept secrets.You can take a boat trip to Duiker Island from there and see the Fur Seals
beautiful. amazing place with great views...seal trips,people selling stuff,eye opening.worth a visit,a great day can be had here

Fish and chips on the rocks. Its a great drive along the peninsula and then around the world famous Chapmans Peak drive that hugs the mountain.What few visitors know about is Fish on the Rocks a little further up past Mariners Wharf. Grab your fish and chips and sit and eat them on the rocks with the seagulls .
Beautiful area close to Capetown. Gorgeous area within easy traveling distance from Capetown. My husband and kids went over to seal island and loved it...the water was very choppy that day.
Lovely old style fish and chips. Worth the visit, informal eating of fish and chips at the harbour. When tummies are full take a drive on the famous and beautiful Chapman's Peak!

Hout Bay-beautiful views and not too far from Cape Town. Gorgeous views, interesting history. if you are with a guide you will learn more. We loved our guide, Laura. She definitely added to the richness of our trip and made the views even more significant.

Unwind with a beauti. Unwind with a beautiful bay view and good food. The beach front is a nice place to relax and destress. For freshly fried fish or calamari with chily ... try "fish on the rocks" ... the food is delicious!
Good for a half-day trip. A charming fishing village. Here there is a nice beach, a couple of good Fich restaurants. The road from Cape Town is beautiful and worth the journey.

Hout Bay. The jewel of the Cape.. A visit to Hout Bay is a must for people going to Cape Town. You must take a drive to the top of Chapmans Peak Drive. The view is possibly the best in South Africa. Very dramatic and emotive. Take a boat ride out to Seal Island and see the seals. Apparently an estimated 3000 seals live in the area. Good eating places are easy to find. And not too far from Cape Town central.

So,etching for everyone and the seaside too. As fascinating seaside town with lots of interesting shops and restaurants. A choice of boat trips and a local craft market make this a great day out. Excellent fish and chil shops or more sophisticated restaurants if you want them. The choice is yours here. Bird world just a short distance inland offers the largest bird park in Africa and probably one of the best anywhere with its walk through aviaries. Reasonable entry price and food freshly cooked and very reasonably priced available. Also a great children's clothes outlet shop marine into Hout Bay called Naarjie. Well worth looking out for if you,want out of the ordinary baby and children's clothes at very reasonable prices

Beautiful area. Hout bay is simply wonderful. Check out the night market on Friday and Saturday evenings down by the harbour (near Fish on the Rocks restaurant). The beaches are great, good fish restaurants and it gives you easy access to Constantia and the Chapman's Peak drive. It's a lot more laid back and quiet than the Cape Town centre so it's nice to escape in this region. There are a lot of hiking trails to do too with immaculate views.
Beautiful. Hungry for good fish n chips? Hout Bay is a definite for lunch! The view of from the harbour is spectacular!
Worth the drive. You will never see views like this in your life. So make the trip and go and see this. Amazing photo opportunities.
Harbour visit. The most beautiful harbour, best fish n chips restaurants and end it all with soft serve. On the coast
Nice little town on the Peninsula. We visit this nice little town frequently to have fish and chips at Mariner's Warf. This time we took an enjoyable trip to Seal Island
Just look and pass it by. not the best to visit as there is just sand being swept up and all over the roads. there are better places to visit but okay for passing through.
Have fun with the seals. A good option to visit when using the Red Bus Citysightseeing. Behind the restaurant there are some seals that are fed by locals. Worth seeing them up close.
Warf. Not much to do, nice beach for pets and few shops and average restaurants, the tame seal provides some entertainment. But still nice if u want to see allot of old fishermans boats.
Stunning!. Amazingly beautiful views will stay with you for a lifetime! Part of a MUST do tour of Cape Penninsula and Cape of Good Hope. You can get boats to take you to see seals here!

SEAL ISLAND!!. Take the boat to seal island! Great view if the water isnt too choppy! Some locals with make there way and sing to you as you exit. There are a few local vendors selling local crafts if you feel like shopping!

Beautiful, beautiful!. Hout Bay is one of those places that seem almost to be too beautiful and picturesque to be real. There is a real political question now about the gentrification of the Bay as it has served for much of the past as the residential area for people who provide services in Cape Town. Development is catching up in this beautiful area. The road along the Western Cape, over this Bay, is awesome!
Breathtaking views of oceans and nice villages, worth a day trip. A very nice, friendly town, beautifully situated near the ocean, with breathtaking views of mountains and villages

Seafood Heaven. The best and freshest selection of seafood can be found at the harbor, from the restaurants and small cafes.The scenery is magnificent, especially when entering town from Chapman's Peak.
Good place if you are a foodie.. A good place to visit with a nice beach and many restaurants choices. I felt safe as a single woman. The views can't be beat.
On the way to the Cape. This is on the way to Cape of Good Hope. The road has stunning scenery. Hout Bay has fishing trawlers and a great market to walk around.

Spectacular in every way. Hout Bay is a vacation spot of your dreams. Friendly people, great, fresh, and usually organic food. Great beach.You can walk to most places in the town. Good center location for all the sights.
Drive all round. Amazing views across the bay and lovely small town with market stalls on the shore. Worth the drive all around the bay
Breathtakingly beautiful!. The drive over Chapman's Peak (toll road) provides exquisite views of Hout Bay. At Hout Bay harbour are a number of basic, but wonderful restaurants.
Worth a trip. What an interesting place. Absolutely gorgeous, lots of history and a diverse population of people. Highly recommended.

Great place to explore - unique experience. This is a unique quiet area. Very serene with the waters different from the other beaches. Its predominantly rocking and was quite windy when we visited so no swimming or lazing on the beach. Great fish and chips.

Hout Bay worth a visit. As a regular visitor to Hout Bay either during the day ot at night, it is worth a visit.During the day a walk on the beach is lovely and there are many places for a coffee or meals. A special mention for Chapmans Peak hotel - sit on the verandah and try the calamari. Or go to Dunes and have a drink and meal.At night there are many restuarants open and most are worth a visit.

Hout Bay market. The Hout Bay indoor market is a treat. Large variety of food and clothing services. For the Banting lovers there are Banting compliant eats and sweet treats. If you simply want some fish and chips, Fish on the Rocks is just across the parking lot. Great way to spend a Sunday
Down market area. This is a stop on one of the hop on and off buses. It's a little down market for us, but beautiful beach all the same. Wouldn't go back
Worth a trip. A lovely part of the area that should be explored. Good eateries are available and great views, everywhere.

The natural beauty of Hout Bay was my catch of the Day!. A very beautiful part of the Peninsula . the entire town and the beautiful form of the bay can be seen from Chapman's peak.I ate at the famous Fish and chips at the Mariner's, A Quaint town with the majority of the population being involved in the fishing industry.

Very nice...... ....... indeed. Photographs do not do it justice, if you are on the Garden Route visiting South Africa you're going to come across this place. Definitely worth a stop. The views, sea & whole place is truly beautiful.

The best fish taverns in capetown are in hout bay!. A calm beach, and on a sunny day, they have a lot going on. We were driving through and stopped to have a fried fish lunch overlooking the bay on a sunny dec afternoon, a memorable visit!

Bike ride to hout bay . There's no better feeling than getting on a bike and riding through to hout bay. It's an amazing experience, no other way of transport can offer this feeling. It's so peaceful and beautiful with an amazing scenery
Lovely and Peaceful. A beautiful place to visit when in Cape Town. Very Peaceful and had the awesome Fish and chips at the Mariner's wharf.

Photographers dream. This is usually a stop on the day tours from Cape Town - it's a quick stop, but I'd have loved to have a longer stop here to sit and enjoy the calm and beauty of the place. It was super windy when we were there, and were told that this was the norm for around here. There's a nice overlook point with a theater style seating that you could easily sit and have lunch there, weather permitting.The roads feel dangerous, but are well maintained and every turn is another oooh-aaah moment.

Seafood Everywhere . Hout bay is home to some of the best sea food places in Cape Town. Marina Wharf is nice for a lunch at the sea. Or even to do some shopping. You can even take a boat ride to seal island from here. It also has a lovely view of the ocean.

good stop off place. worth a visit when travelling along the coast with a few restaurants and good place to buy craft and souvenirs both by the harbour and at the weekly craft market which also has a good range of food. BEWARE the public toilets as beggars hand around trying to get you to pay to use "THEIR" toilets and even intimidated my teenage daughter.

The Saturday Marketplace. Our tour guide took to the Houts Bay Saturday Marketplace for a taste of real local color. We ended up having real tasty and inexpensive lunches, and finding some gifts for family members. I recommend it for anyone looking for something a little different!

Pretty bay with Seals swimming close by. Loved it here, with seals swimming in the habour so close to us. It's a very laid back area with not many tourists around, mainly locals in the market and fishermen. The scenery is really lovely.

Nice quick stopover. Excellent atmosphere of a quiet (relatively) seaside town. Long beach and convenient drive through when visiting the area and beyond. We ate at a fish and chips restaurant which was okay. Highlight was the seabirds who flocked (almost terrifyingly!) when you threw leftovers. The establishments seem to encourage this acrobatic display of the seabirds catching bits of food in mid-air. Fun for my little boy. I just remembered praying silently that there be no bird flu in South Africa!
Beauty. All the beached along this coast are worth a visit. If you get a chance drive around and view some of the amazing homes .
Hout Bay lunch. We had lunch in Hout Bay. The best fish, calamari, prawn and crab sticks I ever had. Right on the beach with a glass of wine.

Beautiful walks, Great Food and Stalls. Always a festive and yet quiet occassion. You can visit the wharf and have some good nosh or go ambling through the shops and stalls. Alternatively you can head out Dunes way for some very lively people and pets after a walk on the beach. Close to backpackers and all the other central places. Love world of birds and natural heritage... walks etc. are ample and don't forget the night market!!!

Beautiful Hout Bay. Hout Bay is definitely one of the Cape's gems. Visit the Hout Bay Harbour Market on the weekend, walk around the harbor and see some of the local fishermen, enjoy delicious food at many nice restaurants. Tourists can also find some fantastic souvenirs in this area.
